choices: Roxxie Roo's back in town
Smiling Jacks has kidnapped April!
Mayor Vivian has Texas arrested
Texas is missing! It's up to April to save the day
Go out on patrol and see what happens (Create a villain)
1.content:
The sun slowly rose over the dusty red mesas, leisurely flooding through the sleepy town of Gold Springs, the old gold mining town nestled snugly at the base of the mountains. At the moment, the town appeared to be perfectly at peace, with nothing breaching the blissful peace save for the gentle twittering of birds.

From this distance, and looking at this serene picture, it would be impossible to tell that this small town was the battleground for a long and hard-fought war. The area in and around Gold Springs was a breeding ground for bandits and thieves, lead by a corrupt and greedy mayor. There was just one obstacles standing in the way of their complete control of the town, and that was the forces of the law, namely Sheriff Texas and her deputy, April, who fought hard to restore the town to its former glory.

As life started to stir around the town, it was time for the sheriff and her deputy to get to work. And who knows what the day would bring...?
1.title: Sunrise

choices: Go to Roxxie's old hideout
Protect the gold coach.
11.content:
"Tex. We've got a problem." April said, coming through the door of the sheriff's office and clipping on her badge and her gun. Texas raised an eyebrow and looked up from her paperwork at her panicked protegee.

"What's up, April?" She asked the fox, who took a deep breath and sighed.

"Roxxie's back in town."

Texas's brow furrowed. Suddenly the day was getting complicated. Roxxie was her oldest and most hated enemy, an eight-foot tall kangaroo bandit who was constantly accompanied by her massive, smelly horse, Butterscotch. Texas had gone head-to-head with her more times than she could count, and win or lose, Roxxie was always a tough foe.

"Fine then. Ah know where her old hideouts are, an' she's a creature of habit. I'll check them out one by one until ah find that varmint." Texas said, standing up and grabbing her revolver from the desk.

"Uhh, there's one other thing, Tex... They're moving a shipment of gold out of town today by coach... If there's any target she'll go after, it's that... So, where do you think she'll be? Her hideout, or the coach?"
11.title: Bad News

choices: Kick down the front door!
Sneak around the back and look for another entrance.
Check out the stables.
111.content:
"It's still early, an' the gold carriage doesn't move until midday. Ah reckon if ah'm fast, ah can catch her at her den before she saddles up, and have her behind bars before they've finished loading the carriage." The weasel says, grabbing her hat and putting it on, then pausing as she walked to the door. "But just in case... you'd better be on that carriage." The weasel walked out to get her horse. Behind her, April sighed worriedly.

"Can do, sheriff... Stay safe."

~~~~~~~~~~~

An hour later, Texas arrived at the outskirts of Roxxie's hideout, a large, battered shack with an even larger barn nearby, meant to be a stable for Butterscotch. Looking around, the weasel could see the telltale signs of lights in the windows, as well as exceptionally large hoofprints leading to the stables, each one as big as her torso.

"Right... Roxxie in the shack, Butterscotch in the stables." She muttered to herself, dismounting and starting to creep forwards, planning out her approach.
111.title: The Hideout

1111.content:
Fortune favours the bold, and Texas had beaten Roxxie many times before. She would make this quick and brutal. The weasel sheriff ran up to the door, then booted it open with a heavy kick.

"FREEZE, YA VARMIN-" She paused as her mind briefly registered the kangeroo gut in front of her, before it slammed into her a split second later with the force of a mule kick, sending her flying backwards into the hard dirt. The weasel slammed down with a grunt, her gun bouncing out of her hand and stars spinning around her head. However, she was just lucid enough to see the grinning kangeroo crouch down, then launch herself into the air with her powerful legs. As Texas watched in a dazed horror, Roxxie sailed through the air and curled herself into a cannonball, her massive butt aimed at Texas with pinpoint accuracy. The last thing the sheriff saw was the giant roo rump filling up her entire vision before-

SQUISH!!

Roxxie snorted with laughter as she ground her butt down on her most hated enemy, enjoying the delicious squelching and crunching noises as she reduced Texas's body to a pathetic pancake.

"Oi, you're just in time, Tex." She snorted with malicious glee. "I was just thinking how hard Butterscotch's saddle is on my ass, but now I have a nice, soft, weasel-fur cushion!" Underneath her, Texas screamed and protested, but was quickly silenced by Roxxie clenching her ass cheeks together, squishing the weasel even further, before getting up and walking to the stables.

Once inside, the bandit wasted no time in grabbing her large leather saddle and saddling up her beloved Butterscotch, making sure to grind her sweaty cheeks together as much as possible during the process. When the massive mare was finally saddled up, Roxxie reached back and peeled the squashed sheriff out of her ass, grinning as she hung limply in her grasp.

"I'll make sure to take the long route, just for you." Roxxie said with a grin. Texas barely managed to summon the energy for a weak mewling whimper before Roxxie slapped her down onto the saddle, which was big enough to fit the entire sheriff's body with room to spare, and mounted up, her fat kangaroo butt slamming down on Texas once again. Butterscotch whinnied in delight at the situation as Roxxie urged her forwards out of the stables, the constant motion of the horse causing the sheriff to be constantly ground flatter and flatter by the bandit's butt.

"Hot today, huh, sheriff? My butt's gonna be getting real swampy, real quick. But I'm sure you can soak that up for me. After all, you've got nothing better to do for the rest of the day..."

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

A long time later, as the sun was beginning to sink below the horizen, Roxxie slowly rode back into her hideout. It had been one of her most successful heists ever, having ended up with two saddlebags filled to the brim with gold nuggets. She had also run into the sheriff's deputy trying to defend the carriage, and had happily trampled the fox into the dirt until she was a whimpering mess.

Roxxie dismounted her loyal steed, then turned to examine her saddle cushion, grinning in delight at what she saw. Due to all the heat and squashing, the weasel sheriff had become fused with the leather saddle, to the point where she now looked like an elaborate decal painted on to the seat. Roxxie ran a hand over the weasel's face, which was a perfect portrait of disgusted horror, and was overjoyed to find that she could not feel the difference between sheriff and seat.

"I think I just got myself a new favourite saddle, Butterscotch! Welcome to your new life, Tex. Beneath me!"
1111.title: Fortune Favours the Bold!

choices: Hide in the bathroom.
Hide in the cupboard.
Confront the bandit!
1112.content:
Roxxie was the main target here, and barging through the front door would be suicide. What Texas needed was a stealthy approach, to take the bandit by surprise. The weasel slowly crept around to the back of the house, her gun drawn, and spotted a back door up ahead, hanging slightly ajar. With a grin, the weasel gently pushed it open noiselessly, and slipped inside the lair of her most dangerous foe.

Ahead of her, a corridor stretched deep into the house, with a few doors branching off to each side, and a large cupboard against one wall. Texas walked forwards and pushed open the closest door, revealing a large, filthy bathroom beyond. The weasel wrinkled her nose in disgust and stepped back, but just as she did so, the sound of heavy footsteps came from further down the corridor, heading in Texas's direction.
1112.title: Back Door

11121.title: Hide in the bathroom.

choices: Roxxie continues uninterrupted
Roxxie finds Tex in her toilet.
111211.content:
The somewhat familiar sound of Roxxies whistles would be heard down the hall as Tex paniced. Sweat rolling down her forehead as she dreaded her fate if Roxxie should find her here.
Having to think quick, Tex darted towards the disgusting toilet, peering down as she saw an endless pile of her nemesis' business. Even the seat got significant splotches of waste scattered around it.

Tex squeaked as the door knob turned, running out of time as she dove into the toilet without thinking. Burrowing herself up to her shoulders in Roxxies booty gunk.

Suddenly, Roxxie would step into the nathroom. As Tex prayed she only had to shower or something.

"Holy fuck. My asshole's gonna explode!" Roxxie exclaimed as she waddled into the bathroom with a newspaper in her hand. "I knew those burritos and fried beans tasted funny."

Suddenly, Tex was greeted by an overwhelming shadow as Roxxies behemoth of a bubble rump hovered above. Slowly descending as her bubbly cheeks would gape wide, exposing her pudgy, bloated butthole as Tex was sealed in complete darkness, except for a tiny sliver of light peering down between Roxxies thighs.
111211.title: hide in the toilet

1112112.content:
The fried beans were quick to make it to the exit and the kangaroo bandit let out a volley of noxious farts. The foul gas had nowhere to go and soon Texas' nose burned with the pervasive stench of Roxxie's farts. She had to stay silent at all costs. If the roo found her here, she would be in even deeper shit, if that was at all possible. But as the farts kept flowing and the stench made her eyes water it became impossible to hold on. The weasel gagged and coughed.

"What the hell!!" Roxxie shouted as she sprung up from the toilet. She turned around to peek down the hole and spot the source of the noise. When she laid eyes on the weasel, buried up to her neck in old shit, the kangaroo fell apart laughing.

"Hahahahaha, what in the name of all that's holy are ye doin in there? Were ya tryin to hide? In ma toilet?! Ah know ah call you a dumbass on the regular, Tex, but this has gotta be the single dumbest thing ah ever dun saw." Her belly still rumbled with the fried beans and a cruel smirk grew on her face. "Well then, sheriff. If it's shit you want, allow me to oblige."

With a smug grin the roo turned her back on the weasel, looming her huge butt over the toilet hole. Roxxie parted her cheeks, showing off that filthy hole once more, and plopped herself down. She wouldn't get up again until her bowels were completely empty. To add just a pinch of extra torment the bandit also closed her legs, ensuring all her foul emissions would be trapped down there with the weasel. The farts didn't wait long to emerge, sputtering out of the roo's twitching asshole and filling the sheriff's environment with nasty stench. Soon the gas began to subside and with a subtle squelch the bandit started to take a shit in earnest. Solid lumps of horrid waste smacked the weasel on her head and rolled in front of her face. But as the solid material passed the beans hit the main stage.

Roxxie cried out in agonized relief as a steady stream of thick, fetid gunk poured from her rear. Like warm mud it was heaped onto the sheriff, who loudly retched and sputtered below. Hearing the weasel's misery lifted the roo's spirits as her ass felt like it was on fire. She cursed her gluttony and held her big belly. With a wry smile she could only imagine how bad it had to be for Texas. It spurred the kangaroo bandit on to fight through the pain and give it her all. After what felt like an eternity the roo's hole finally got to relax, having delivered a horrifying payload right onto the weasel's head. But Roxxie Roo was not finished yet. She would've just called it a day here, but now that she had her nemesis trapped in her toilet, the bandit was going to take her time. She may not be able to give a shit anymore, but her gut was still a champ at producing the foulest farts in the West.

Texas winced at the rotten stench of the crap smeared all over her. In the darkness of Roxxie's toilet she couldn't see a thing, but she felt the uncomfortable warmth of the sticky mess clinging to her. The smell defied all description and just in case it wasn't nightmarish enough the butthole looming over the weasel added even more in the form of lengthy, rancid farts. Specs of crap still sprayed as the last remnants of Roxxie's bowel movement were blown out in the foul winds. Even when the kangaroo ran out of farts she didn't get up, adamant to trap the weasel down there with her concentrated stink for as long as possible. When the bandit's thick legs started to get a little numb she finally stood up, turning around to admire her handiwork. Roxxie smiled, looking down on the barely conscious weasel.

"Now you stay nice 'n put, alright?" She taunted before taking a few shaky steps on her semi-numb legs and leaving the bathroom. From her fetid new prison the weasel tried to wiggle out, much akin to how she got herself in to this predicament. But horror set in as she realized the shit around her had compacted and completely immobilized her. From the other room she could hear two excited voices shouting back and forth, interrupted by bellowing laughter. The conversation finally died down and after some time even the smell of Roxxie's farts seemed to dissipate. But after only an hour had passed the bathroom door swung open and in strod Georgia.

"Hot damn, it really is you. Ah'm a little curious how ya ended up there, but let's be honest here Texas, we both know what's gotta happen here." The mare said haughtily as she turned around and dropped her pants. The terrified weasel looked up to the monumentally huge ass of Georgia descending on her. She'd been squashed flatter than a sheet of paper several times beneath that colossal mass, but now it just made the wooden seat of the toilet creak as it sealed the weasel into smelly darkness once more. The horse may not have any rotten turds to add to the pile right now, but farts began to flow in abundance. Though her wretched stink couldn't quite match the intensity of Roxxie's, the mare's farts still carried their own uniquely disgusting stench. She contently patted her belly after emptying it of all the gas present. Georgia stood up and with a smug grin turned to face the weasel.

"Don't worry, ah'll get ya some horse apples later, Texas. Me 'n Roxxie are gonna enjoy buryin ya in there."

The bandits were true to their words and with every day the weasel was covered further in their foul shit as the toilet slowly filled up. When the sheriff couldn't be seen anymore the two threw a big party, celebrating their victory. Vivian appointed Georgia to be the new sheriff and together the two brutes pillaged everyone in Gold Springs that Vivian didn't like. Neither of the big-bottomed bandits ever managed to make sense of the weasel's decision to hide in their toilet, but they would laugh about it for the rest of their infamous careers.
1112112.title: The worst plan in the history of the West

Roxxie moves on
11122.content:
Wasting no time, Texas immediately wrenched open the doors of the nearby cupboard and wedged herself inside the tight, cluttered space, filled with old clothes and tools lying haphazardly. It barely had enough room to fit her, but with a bit of manoeuvring, she managed to get the door closed behind her, just in time to hear the loud, booming footsteps stomping down the corridor. As the weasel watched through the slats in the cupboard door, she could see the massive kangaroo bandit walking down the hall, her butt so big that it grazed the walls on either side of her as her hips swayed from either side. As she was right outside the cupboard, her butt pinning the door closed, the roo suddenly stopped, frowning at the open back door.

"I don't remember leaving that open..." She said, suspiciously, gazing around and peering into the bathroom, then just shrugging. "Eh, musta just been the wind. And speaking of wind..." Roxxie's stomach suddenly rumbled and gurgled alarmingly, before she let out a long, loud blast of gas from her oversized rear, the foul gas spreading all through the surrounding area. Inside the cupboard, the roo's foul gas washed over Texas, who gagged in horror.

"Ahhhh... Better out than in! Just wish I had a certain weasel's face to soak up that gas." The roo said with a devious chuckle, blasting out another, even longer fart following the first. Inside the cupboard, that certain weasel tried to hold her breath for as long as possible in an attempt to stay silent, but it didn't look like the roo was in any hurry to leave the surrounding area, and Texas was running out of air.
11122.title: Hide in the cupboard.

Roxxie doesn't notice anything out of the ordinary!
111221.content:
Texas couldn't help herself, the thick gas of the surrounding area was far too strong to bare; Being Texas' greatest villian, Roxxie had the worst gas Texas had encountered throughout her days as sheriff. (Well, second worst. Butterscotch, Roxxie's obese mare, had near nuclear gas) and Texas had to gag, albeit, very slightly. Still, it was enough to make Roxxie's ears pipe up just a bit. "What was that?" She glared as she spoke, and began to search the kitchen cupboards, all the while letting out more gas. Texas was able to contain her disgust, for the time being.


Texas looked around, knowing Roxxie would check her cabinet soon. She started covering herself up with old clothes and tools, trying to make it seem at all like she wasn't hiding there. Texas hoped Roxxie, once she looked in the cabinet, wouldn't notice her laying under the pile of clothes.


Roxxie continued to search each and every single cabinet. "Whomever I find has a date with my rear end, and a bowl of five alarm chili! And if you're still alive, I'm gonna have Butterscotch finish ya off!" Texas started to pray to every known deity that Roxxie would be unable to find her.


Finally, Roxxie opened the cupboard that contained Sheriff Texas...

1112211.content:
Despite the cupboard looking to Texas like a bomb had hit it, Roxxie knew all her messy cupboards and closets well, and definitely remembered that this was not how she left it. Scanning around the tight space, her eyes soon noticed the tip of a very familiar braid, barely visible but sticking out from beneath the piled up clothes. With a grin, the roo turned around as if to leave.

"Well, guess there's nothin' there... Musta been my imagination." She says loudly and convincingly, as she silently moves herself into position, then quickly slams her butt back as fast as she could, wedging her ridiculous rump into the closet and smashing Texas against the back wall, the entire space filled with her fat butt. Texas yelps in fear as she was suddenly pinned, Roxxie's massive, sweaty and, above all, putrid smelling ass pressed right up against her.

"Ha! Looks like I've caught a little thief in my house. Or maybe just some stupid sheriff snoopin' around. Still, this must be a familiar sight for you by now, Tex." The roo says, looking back with an evil grin as she ground her butt over the weasel. Texas gasped as she felt the pressure intensify on her, her arms pinned by her side.

"Let me go, ya varmint! Else ah'll kick yer fat butt from here t' town, an' you know it!" She bluffed. While it was true that she and Roxxie were pretty evenly matched in a straight-up fight, Roxxie had just about the biggest advantage possible, and she knew it. The roo just laughed.

"Yeah, sure, Sheriff! I've got a counter offer. How about I take that cute little face o' yours, jam it between my cheeks, and gas you 'til sundown!" She laughs victoriously. Before Texas could protest, the roo's tail wrapped around her face and jammed her straight between the bulbous, oversized cheeks. "Lights out, Sheriff!!" Roxxie roared, then began to blast out a hellish storm of farts right into the weasel's face, every single blast of gas pouring straight into her weak weasel nose as she was forced to sniff it all up. Almost immediately her mind began to get cloudy, and the last thing she experienced before she passed out was Roxxie's mocking laughter, and the smell of her farts in her nose...

"I've got big plans for you, Sheriff!"
1112211.title: Roxxie sees her!

11122111.content:
Texas woke up in a puddle of mud, with her legs tied together, and her hands handcuffed to the wooden fence of the stable. The strong smell of manure and other ungodly things hit her nose almost instantly. Then she heard the sinister laughter of Roxxie. "Having trouble, Tex?" Texas tried to fire back, but discovered she'd been gaged. With a worn pair of Roxxie's panties no less. "Now, Tex, I've got a little bit of a game for you. It's an easy one, honestly. All you have to do is stay awake, for... Let's say, a half hour... and I'll take you back inside, and you and I will do something else. If you happen to fall asleep, for some, odd, reason... Well... I think I'm just gonna leave you in here for awhile, with your new friend..."


Roxxie then walked over to the other side of the stable, the ground shaking as she did, and unlocked the gate. Roxxie smirked. "She's all yours, girl." She stated, and left the stable. The ground shook even further as the massive mare known as Butterscotch entered the main stable, looking right at Texas the entire time. Texas tired to beg, plead, or something, none of it audible at all from the gag of Roo's nasty panties. Butterscotch was slow in her approach, taunting Texas the entire time. Suddenly, she turned around, and Texas was greeted to the ungodly sight of Butterscotch's rear end. It was larger than Texas' entire body, and filthier than any of the cows Smiling Jack owned. Texas let out a whimper, as Butterscotch lowered her rear, slowly flattening Texas beneath it...

Texas was in hell. As soon as the massive mare's butt had crashed down on top of her, squishing her into a weasel pancake, Butterscotch had started blasting out an unstoppable maelstrom of farts right into her face. Again and again and again the weasel was buffeted with the most abhorrent gas imaginable, flooding her nose with the scent of putrid horse manure and sending her mind reeling, but Texas held on, focusing only on staying awake, and knowing that to be knocked out now spelt doom for her...

Almost fourty-five minutes later, Roxxie walked back into the barn, whistling happily to herself and grinning at the sight of her horse slamming her ass down and continuing her rain of farts. However, as the mare lifted her butt up for inspection, the kangeroo was shocked to see Texas twitching still, even managing to lift her head and glare at her. Roxxie burst out laughing at the sight of the sheriff.

"Ha! Guess you are tougher than you look, Tex! Though at the moment ya look like a horse's fart cushion. Cause, y'know, you are..." She grinned, walking up to the weakened sheriff and planting a foot on her back to keep her pinned down. "Still, a promise is a promise, so you're comin' inside. Probably for the best, really, cause..."

And when your good buddy April shows up, I'm gonna give her to Butterscotch, as a new fart cushion!" Roxxie laughed again, and Tex gulped, hoping April didn't come looking for her.

As Texas lay on the ground, gagging and retching in horror and disgust, the huge roo turned around and shook her giant butt at her tauntingly, the massive, smelly, unwashed expanse swaying above the downed weasel.

The weasel summoned her strength and digs her claws deep into the wooden floor, stopping Roxxie in her tracks, and when the roo turned around to see what had happened, she was met with the sight of Texas's feet slamming into her face, knocking her backwards. After I subdue you, I've got a big bowl of 5-alarm chili, and a gallon of rotten milk, that I'm gonna use as fuel, to smother you in the worst farts anyone has ever known!" Roxxie laughed evilly, and Tex felt her stomach sink at the very idea of it. She had to win, or escape, whichever opportunity came first!



Tex changed at Roxxie one more time, but she ran right into a right hook! Texas stopped dead in her tracks, and fell back to the floor, her head spinning. Roxxie grinned and stood over her.


"Lights out, Sheriff!"


Roxxie then dropped her massive butt on the sheriff, crushing her, and knocking her out cold. Once she knew Tex was out, Roxxie got up, and started preparing her meal...
111221111222.title: Texas loses, and loses hard...

1112211112221.content:
As Texas slowly came to, she groaned and went to rub her head, only to find that her hand was firmly chained down to something. The weasel gave a gasp, instantly sobering up from her groggy daze, and began to look around desperately. She was in some sort of massive chair, presumably Roxxie's from the smell, and her arms and legs had been chained to the armrests and legs of the chair, leaving her body stretched out over the seat of the cushion. Texas instantly began to struggle desperately against the solid chains keeping her in place, but at that moment Roxxie stepped into the room, chugging down a carton of old milk and carrying a bowl of chili. Their eyes locked for a second, Texas frozen with fear, then Roxxie just grinned and threw the empty carton over her shoulder, burping loudly.

"Ahhh! Welcome to your new place in life, Tex!" She said, stomping over, and causing Texas to struggle even more. "I think we both always knew you'd end up here eventually. After all, it's pretty much exactly where you deserve to be!" The massive kangaroo reached the chair, then slowly and tauntingly turned around, shaking her massive hips above the doomed weasel, and letting her get a good look at her colossal, jiggling ass.

"No! Stay back ya varmint! I'll get you fer this! Jus' you wait! April'll save me!" She shouts. Roxxie just laughs and shrugs.

"Maybe. Maybe not. All I know is that it's almost a full day's ride to get out here. And I'm gonna use that day to it's fullest!" Without another word, the massive roo sprung into the air with her powerful legs, and the last thing the screaming weasel got to see was the underside of Roxxie's mighty ass, before it smashed down like a meteorite, flattening Texas into a weasel pancake and cracking one of the chair legs.

"Ahhh! Just as comfortable as I thought it'd be!" Roxxie said, slowly grinding her bulbous, fat ass over the flattened sheriff beneath, getting her good and lodged between the her cheeks. "Now, time to break my new fart cushion in."

As Texas wailed and whimpered beneath her nemesis's ass, she was only met with evil laughter as the roo began to blast out fart after rank, sulphurous fart into the weasel's nose, each one worse than the last and burning Texas's nose with their stink. As the devastating fartstorm continued beneath her, Roxxie simply picked up her bowl of chili and chowed down, making sure she had fuel for hours.

~~~


After Texas's disappearance, April had been completely ready to go off after her, but Mayor Vivian had other plans. She wasted no time in appointing the corrupt Georgia to the position of sheriff, and the mare had set about making some radical changes to the sheriff's office. The first of which was demoting April from 'deputy sheriff' to 'sheriff's butt cushion' (A position that Georgia invented and Vivian authorised), and the fox spent the rest of her career as a lawgirl under Sheriff Georgia's ass. As for Texas, she managed to hold out admirably, lasting almost a year before the constant fart torture broke her down, and she became a brainwashed slave for Roxxie, sniffing up her farts without hesitation and doing absolutely anything the roo asked of her, no matter how demeaning or disgusting.
1112211112221.title: The end of Tex

choices: "Butterscotch flatten you into a tattoo!"
"You become Butterscotch's roommate!"
111221112.content:
Beneath the massive mare's rotten rump, Texas could only scream muffledly as she was, ground, slammed, squeltched and splattered completely flat. It didn't take Butterscotch long at all to have smushed Texas into a comfortable seat, but this was where the real test of endurance for the weasel started. Nearby, Roxxie had been kind enough to leave a huge trough of feed, and Butterscotch took great pleasure in chowing down on it. Almost immediately the horse's stomach started rumbling, but Butterscotch, well trained in how to torture Tex, simply lifted her tail and started to vent all of her gas straight onto the crushed weasel in a never-ending stream of nuclear horse flatulence. Though the weasel wanted nothing more than to scream and protest and cry for help, with the gag in her mouth and the horse pressing down on her, all she could do was whimper muffledly and be subjected to some of the worst farts imaginable, manure bombs brewed up in the chemical factor of Butterscotch's stomach to be delivered straight to Texas's face. Try as she might to stay awake, the smell was simply too much for her, particularly after the ordeal with Roxxie before, and soon enough, the weasel was out cold.

~~~

A half-hour later, Roxxie came walking back to the stables, whistling happily to herself, and gave Butterscotch a pat on the nose. The horse whinny'd and stood up immediately, revealing the paper-thin, foul-smelling and, worst of all, passed out sheriff. Roxxie tutted unhappily, then grabbed a bucket of water from nearby and dumped it on top of her, waking her up, though she was still restrained and gagged.

"Tsk, tsk, tsk... I thought you were meant to be tough, Tex? Frankly I'm disappointed.... Ah heck, no I'm not! Cause now I get to see..."
111221112.title: Lights out, Tex

1112211121.content:
The word "Tattoo" echoed in Texas's mind, making her shiver all over. Roxxie snapped her fingers, a signal that Texas had seen before and knew exactly what it meant. She shook her head in horror, begging for mercy, but all that did was make Roxxie laugh her head off as she walked away so Butterscotch could do her work. There would be nothing to save the weasel this time.

The fat mare lowered her hindquarters over Texas, completely covering her.from outside eyes. But this time, instead of letting her worst gas fly, Butterscotch clenched her cheeks and picked Texas up with just her ass. Then, still holding her fat behind closed, she trotted over to a large metal pole that was placed conspicuously in the center of her pen. She faced her ass towards it, then lunged backwards, slamming into it as hard as she could while simultaneously letting out another atomic blast of gas.

Texas screamed in pain and disgust, but her torture was only just beginning. Butterscotch ground her ass into the pole, wiping up and down on it like she was trying to scratch the worst itch she'd ever had. Up and down, up and down Butterscotch flossed her crack with the smooth metal pole, letting out continuous farts as she slowly ground poor Texas into a fine paste between her greasy cheeks. She leaned all her weight into it, nearly bending the sturdy metal pole and putting every ounce of pressure into the squashed weasel as she could. All the while, the mare sported the happiest, dreamiest expression on her face as if she could keep doing this happily for the rest of her days. And she planned on it.

When Butterscotch pulled her ass from the pole nearly an hour later, there wasn't a trace of Texas. Not a moan or a twitch or a lost shred of clothing. Butterscotch trotted over to her master and presented her hindquarters. Roxxie snickered to herself and grabbed a hold of the horse's ass, spreading those cheeks wide.

"Let's see what you've got!"

Spread from one cheek to the other was a smeared on tattoo of Texas's terrified face, looking like "The Scream". Her gaping mouth was positioned directly over Butterscotch's asshole. It was by far the best butt tattoo that Butterscotch had ever done. And by far the worst fate Texas could've imagined
1112211121.title: Horse Tattoos

1112211122.content:
"I finally get to see you become Butterscotch's roommate!"


Texas tried to move, struggle, do anything to escape her current situation. Living with Butterscotch, in her pen?! It was a death sentence for sure. Texas could do nothing as Roxxie locked the door to the stable, sealing Texas' fate. Texas groaned, as Butterscotch's shadow eclipsed the sun coming through the stable window. Texas looked up at the massive mare, who she would be bunk mates with from this point forward. Texas whimpered as Butterscotch grinned wildly. A rumble in the massive horse's stomach sent a shiver down Texas' spine. Texas looked at the ground where Butterscotch was sitting. The dirt had turned into a near radioactive mud from Butterscotch's pure filth. Texas closed her eyes as Butterscotch rose up. The massive mare used her teeth to reposition Texas, so that she was propped up on the haybale she was leaned against. Now most of Texas' body was laying on the top of the haybale. Butterscotch then planted her massive ass down, squashing Texas, and treating her to an endless buffet of horse gas.





Texas never escaped Butterscotch, leaving Apirl forced to take up sheriff duties herself. It all went well, until one bad run in with the the bunny, Smiling Jacks. Jacks managed to tie up April, who was now a mere inches away from her prized cow, Bessie's, endless backside.


"Well, sheriff... Looks like this is it for you. Bessie, sit!"


And the cow did.



The End
1112211122.title: "You become Butterscotch's roommate!"

choices: Butterscotch wakes up!
The horse goes back to sleep.
1113.content:
Butterscotch, Roxxie's colossal horse, was one of the most deadly weapons at the kangeroo's disposal. If Texas could find a way to lock her in her stables, that would go a long way to leveling the playing field. The weasel nodded to herself and headed forwards to the stables, flattening herself against the wall and cautiously peering around the stable doors.

Looking inside, Texas was treated first and foremost to a perfect view of the horse's massive, sweaty, filth-stained ass, pointed right at her and on full display. The weasel froze, certain that she had just stumbled into a trap, until she heard the faint snoring sounds coming from the horse. Butterscotch was fast asleep.

Unable to believe her luck, the sheriff grinned widely and stepped into the stables, looking for a study plank to block the doors with while the horse was out cold. Unfortunately, just as she did so, the sleeping Butterscotch lifted her tail.

Before Texas could react, a gaseous eruption blasted out of the horse's ass and hit Texas like a brick wall, sending her hat flying out of the stables and spraying her with the toxic fumes and horse-sweat. The weasel gagged and coughed while horse flatulence clung to her clothes and fur like a manure perfume, filling her nose with the ungodly smell. She fell to her knees, gasping noisily for fresh air, but only got more horse farts as a second blast rolled out not long after the first, the force knocking her onto her butt and the smell leaving her in a helpless daze. While the sheriff whimpered and gagged in disgust from the ground, the horse slowly began to stir, her rest having been disturbed by the noisy sounds of distress.
1113.title: Faced with a Horse's Ass

choices: Dive through the window!
Glass cuts hurt. Take your chances in the pen.
11131.content:
Texas froze with terror as she watched the enormous horse's eyelids open, the pupils growing with surprise as they realized there was an intruder.

The sheriff put her finger over her lips in a "shhhh" symbol, desperately hoping Roxxie's horse had a little more mercy than her owner. She found the limits of her wishful thinking when the horse gave out a loud neigh of surprise.

"What's up, Butterscotch?" a familiar voice cried from inside the hideout. Texas' ears rang with terror as she heard the loud thumps of kangaroo feet moving down stairs. She was soon to be discovered.

"Well, well, well! What do we have here?" Roxxie asked with a massive grin as she peaked through the window of the stables and saw a small weasel staring back at her like a deer in headlights. "It looks like you're a few miles away from your jail cells, sheriff."

Tex reached for her pistol, but realized she must have lost it when she was blasted back by the horse's gas. It had probably sunk into the muddy ground of the rain-soaked stable, never to be found again.

"Ah don't need a jail cell to pummel you!" the sheriff bluffed, intimidation being her only weapon left.

"And I don't need to pummel you to pummel you." The kangaroo laughed as she locked the door to the stables and pulled up a lawn chair to the window. "You think Butterscotch was waking me up so I could deal with you? Nah. She was waking me up so I could watch."

Texas looked at the horse, which nodded in agreement. A smile crept across her face.

The sheriff screamed as she started running around the pen, the horse giving chase. The two darted back and forth throughout the small enclosure, Texas just barely dodging being trampled and bull-rushed with nimble leaps and wild-west agility. Her eyes frantically searched the room for any way she might be able to leave, but her options seemed to be vanishing fast.

The only possible exit seemed to be the window through which Roxxie watched the hilarious ordeal. Tex could easily dive through it, but it would take a lot out of her; then she'd be right at the feet of her least favorite kangaroo. Still... it might be the only chance she had.
11131.title: Bad Luck

111312.content:
Texas started to move towards the window, but couldn't get running at the full speed she needed to propel herself through it. The idea of all that jagged glass all over her body followed by dealing with Roxxie seemed like an impossible challenge to overcome. She leapt out of the way of a headbutt attack from Butterscotch, who was getting closer to catching her with each second.

"Keep running, Tex!" Roxxie laughed from the window. "You're gonna have to get tired sometime!"

Texas feared that the kangaroo's words would be prophetic, but her prediction actually would never come to pass. It wasn't fatigue that stopped Texas from staving off the inevitable; it was mud.

Tex let out a gasp of terror as she realized the wet gloop that was the floor of the stable had tripped her up. She reached her hands out to catch herself, but the ground was too sloppy to put any sort of weight onto. She floundered on the floor like a fish out of water.

"It's showtime..." the Kangaroo chided from the window as she watched her prized horse approach the helpless sheriff. "I'm going to enjoy this sooo much."

Texas looked up and screamed with displeasure as Butterscotch turned around and began to sit down. She wasn't even going to be defeated by her worst enemy; her game over was going to take place beneath the butt of her enemies' HORSE. The humiliation was unbearable.

Roxxie cheered and clapped as she watched the horse sit casually on the ground, sending mud flying in every direction as the sheriff was buried beneath her. The weasel attempted to scream, but she was silenced as she became one with the dirt.

The horse gave a satisfied grunt as she completed her seat, and looked over to make eye contact with her master. She was happy to have proven her loyalty to Roxxie.

"Enjoy it under there." the kangaroo said to the un-seeable pancake located somewhere in the dirt under her prized horse. "You'll be there for a looong time."
111312.title: Glass cuts hurt. Take your chances in the pen.

choices: Get Butterscotch Drunk
Overfeed Butterscotch
11132.content:
Texas acted fast and removed her hands from her nose and placed them on her mouth. She endured the ghastly gas wafting in the air and summoned everything she had to repress her groans of disgust. She remains absolutely still waiting to see what the mare would do. Seconds felt like hours and for a moment the gas was the least of her concerns. Butterscotch smacks her lips, snorts.....

And then falls back asleep. Texas lets out a sigh of relief, just as Butterscotch rips one more nasal torturing fart before returning to sleep. Once the danger has passed, Texas fans the air with her hat and resumes her search. After a good ten minutes of carefully tiptoeing around the stables, occasionally stepping in to a recent payload of poop, the sheriff couldn't find anything that could possibly hold the massive mare. Even if she did, from the looks of it she could probably smash her way out if needed.

Texas needed to find some way to put the mare out of commission. For a moment she considered putting a bullet in its head but aside from being inhumane the gunshot would probably alert Roxxie. As she examines the room again, the sheriff composes a new plan. Looking up the second floor of the barn, she climbs up and discovered crates of stolen loot. None carrying treasure but food, hay, and alcohol. As soon as she laid eyes on it, Texas gets an idea.

The first idea she notices is to get the horse drunk on stolen whiskey. If she could get the horse drunk and put her out of commission, then Roxxie can't commit her robbery or make a getaway. At least, that is if she could convince the horse to drink. The second idea is to wake up Butterscotch and have her eat all the food stored up here. Texas was confident a beast of that size would love a feast of that caliber and once she's full, she shouldn't be able to run as fast. Only problem is Roxxie would definitely notice if her steed suddenly gained an immense amount of weight.

Texas had to choose fast. Roxxie could come in at any moment and even in her sleep Butterscotch wasn't letting up on her gas.
11132.title: The horse goes back to sleep.

choices: Leap out guns blazing!
Play it smart and stealthy.
112.content:
"Yer right. Ah could waste all mornin' checkin' her hangouts, but at the end o' the day, she'll be goin' after the gold." Texas gives April a nod, and gets one in return. "Alright, you hold down the fort here, partner. I'll be back with that fat-ass roo in no time."

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

It was a few hours later now, and Texas lay hidden inside the coach, surrounded by crates of gold nuggets. The carriage drivers had been more than happy to let the sheriff tag along when she explained the situation, going so far to even lend her a spare rifle in addition to her usual revolver. If Roxxie did attack, Texas would make sure she had a bad time.

However, at this point the sheriff was having her doubts. They had been travelling for a while now, and if they went any further, they would be safely within the limits of the next town over. Maybe Roxxie didn't know about the carriage. Maybe-

The carriage suddenly jerked to a halt, yanking Texas from her thoughts. The weasel sat up and slightly tugged back the curtain blocking one window, seeing exactly what she expected. About thirty yards ahead was the rotton roo herself, smirking down at the carriage from atop her massive, fat steed, easily as big as the coash Texas was hiding in. In one of the roo's hands was a pair of colossal saddle bags, and in the other was an extra-large revolver.

"I'm sure you know how this works by this point." Roxxie says, smiling at the carriage drivers and tossing the saddlebags forwards into the dusty desert road. "Start loading 'em up."

As the carriage crew scurried over to grab the saddlebags, Texas narrowed her eyes and held her rifle at the ready, debating how to deal with this. If she leapt out of the coach now she would have the drop on Roxxie, but might put the crew in danger. On the other hand, if she climbed out the opposite door of the carriage, she might be able to circle around the sand dunes and get the drop on the bandit, but if she was seen the element of surprise, her only advantage, would be lost.
112.title: A Golden Opportunity

choices: Grab the rifle!
Grab the revolver!
1121.content:
With an athletic leap, Texas launched herself out of the stagecoach like a coiled spring, rifle at the ready and aimed right at Roxxie.

"Freeze, ya varmint!" The sheriff yelled. Roxxie's eyes widened, but she reacted lightning fast, spurring her horse to take evasive manouvers as she fired at the sheriff. Texas ducked behind the carriage as the bandit's bullets tore splintered chunks out of the wood, returning fire blindly. The stagecoach horses whinned in fear as the bullets whizzed around them, then stampeded forwards. Texas yelped as the carriage slammed into her, sending her flying, her rifle and her revolver landing in the sand nearby. Roxxie didn't fair any better, as the bandit yanked her horse's reigns to avoid crashing into the carriage, but Butterscotch reared up and accidently threw her off, the bandit landing in the sand as well.

Both the sheriff and the outlaw got to their feet and paused momentarily, staring at each other across the sand and waiting for the other to react. Texas's eyes glanced down to the weapons laying nearby, both of them covered in a thick layer of sand, then back up to Roxxie. She would only have time to go for one gun before the kangaroo was upon her, and if the gun had jammed, she was done for.
1121.title: Attack!

choices: Chase after her!
The carriage comes first.
11211.content:
The girls moved almost simultaniously, with Texas leaping for her rifle and Roxxie charging fowards at the sheriff, trying to shoulder-slam her. The weasel sheriff pounced on the rifle and rolled to her feet, instantly firing two shots into the sand at Roxxie's feet, stopping the kangeroo fast in her tracks.

"I got you...ya varmint..." Texas panted. "Yer under arrest." Roxxie's eyes narrowed, standing perfectly still, before a cruel smile spread across her face.

"Guess again, Tex."

The weasel's brow furrowed, confused, until she felt the hot, wet breath on the back on her neck and froze in fear. Behind her stood Butterscotch, glaring at the sheriff and snorting angrily. Texas spun around to try to shoot at her, but Butterscotch was faster, turning and slamming her gigantic ass down on top of the weasel, Texas disappearing with a squeak and a splat. Roxxie breathed a sigh of relief, then dashed over and climbed back on her seated horse.

"Let's get outta here!" The horse whinnied in agreement, but lifted a leg and blasted out a rank, eggy fart over the flattened sheriff before getting up and dashing off.

Behind them, Texas was left half-buried in the ground, the fumes of the horse fart slowly rising off her prone form. She groaned in pain and gradually pushed herself to her feet, surveying the scene in front of her. The carriage was a mess, with large chunks of wood shot out of it and crates of gold spilled all over the road. The crew of the carriage was thankfully unharmed, cowering behind a nearby sand dune, but what really caught Texas's eye was that one of the stage coach horses had managed to break free, now standing a few meters away, and giving Texas an inviting opportunity to chase down Roxxie. But if she did so, she'd have to leave the stage coach crew alone and undefended in bandit territory.
11211.title: The One That Got Away

choices: Jump!!
She'll have to find another way around...
112111.content:
The stagecoach could wait. Texas was not letting Roxxie get away. The weasel dashed up and vaulted onto the brown bay mare, then instantly urged it forwards with a loud 'hyah!' riding off bareback to the sounds of angry yelling from the crew. Texas made a mental note to buy them a new stage coach when all this was over, but for now, she had a job to do.

While Butterscotch was the deadliest horse in the west, she wasn't particularly fast, and at full speed Texas quickly caught up to them in Snake Canyon, a tight space with sheer red rocks on either side. Ahead of them, Roxxie glanced back and snarled, then yanked her reigns to the left, Butterscotch slamming her oversized rump into the rock wall. Instantly the dry, brittle rocks crumbled and collapsed, rocks and dirt flooding across in a mini-landslide and blocking the path.
112111.title: Give Chase!

1121111.content:
Texas cursed under her breath. Going around the rocks would take too much time, and Roxxie could easily lose her in the labyrinthian canyon if she got out of sight. There was only one option left.

"Come on, girl! Don't fail me now! HYAH!" The weasel spurred her horse forwards towards the rock wall, urging her to jump. And perhaps, if it had been Texas's own fearless steed, it would have worked.

This, however, was a stagecoach horse, not particularly well trained and also very tired from the chase. It had been shot at, yelled at and ridden bare back, and it had had more than enough. The mare dug her hooves into the ground to stop herself, but Texas wasn't so lucky. The weasel blinked in surprise as the momentum carried her forwards and sent her flying through the air, screaming and flailing her arms until-

SPLAT!

Butterscotch glanced back in confusion, then snickered as she saw a certain weasel sheriff splattered across her filthy butt, spread-eagled and flat as paper, her face stuck right in the horse's ass-crack and her tail twitching in pain. Roxxie burst out into fits of snorting laughter as the massive mare whinnied in delight as she jigged her butt-cheeks, watching as the sheriff jiggled along perfectly like a tattoo.

"Nice leap, sheriff! Good thing Butterscotch was here to catch you, huh?" She said happily, while the mare started to parade around happily, Texas being ground up between her sweaty, oversized cheeks, wailing muffledly as she was flattened and smeared with horse-filth. "It's fifty miles from here to the hideout, Tex, but Butterscotch will keep you entertained for the ride. The three of us are gonna have a lot of fun together.." With that, the bandit spurred her horse forwards into a gallop, quickly grinding Texas to a sweaty mush between the filthy cheeks, showing the weasel her new place in life.
1121111.title: Splat...

choices: A weasel's work is never done.
Texas receives a letter from Roxxie, challenging her to a duel.
112112.content:
As tempting as it was to go after the bandit, the sheriff's job first and foremost was to protect the citizens of her town. With a heavy sigh, Texas watched Roxxie ride into the distance, before the weasel waved to the stagecoach crew, giving them the all clear. In a quick hour, the horses were hitched back to the carraige and the gold loaded up, the carriage resuming it's journey.

The rest of the day was fairly uneventful for the sheriff as the stagecoach completed it's long trip to the next town, where Texas departed and said her farewells to the crew, who gracously lent her a horse to get home. However, Texas wasn't sure she was done just yet. Roxxie still had hideouts in the area, and there were a few hours of daylight left. The sheriff still had work to do.
112112.title: A Safe Delivery

11212.content:
Texas leapt for her sand-covered revolver just as Roxxie charged right at her. The weasel was a professional though, and effortlessly grabbed the pistol and rolled to her feet, aiming at the charging roo.

*Click*

Roxxie paused, surprised, then grinned and started to advance at a much more lesuirely pace, Texas's eyes growing wide with fear as she desperately pulled the trigger of the jammed gun again and again.

*Click* *Click* *Click* *Cl-WHAM!*

Roxxie's massive, meaty fist slammed straight into the sheriff's stomach. The weasel squeaked in surprise and pain, her eyes bugging out of her head, then collapsed onto the ground, hugging her winded stomach. The beatdown had barely even begun however, as Roxxie lifted a foot and slammed it down onto Texas's face again and again, trampling it flat with unmatched brutality, and quickly stomping the weasel into unconciousness.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

When she finally came to, the first thing the sheriff noted was the ungodly stench of manure permiating the air around her. She gagged and instinctively tried to struggle, but found that her wrists and legs were bound tightly with rope and stretched out into an X-shape. All at once the weasel's senses returned to her, and she opened her eyes to be confronted with a truly horrifying sight: Butterscotch's filthy ass at point-blank range. As if knowing she was awake, the horse instantly blasted out a symphony of foul fumes right into Texas's face, causing her to whimper and struggle as she was sprayed with the foul muck clinging to the horse's butt.

From on top of the horse, Roxxie grinned and glanced back, seeing the weasel tied tight to her mighty steed's ass with coarse ropes. The stagecoach was nowhere in sight, but the saddlebags on Butterscotch seemed to be overflowing, a testament to another successful robbery. However, this time they had scored an even more valuable prize.

"Oi, look Butterscotch! Your new playmate has finally woken up. Why don't you give her some kisses?" She asked, and the horse whinnied happily in agreement, starting to blast out fart after fart in the weasel's face, making her scream and sob in disgust. Roxxie just smirked. "Better get used to those real quick, Sheriff, because when we get back, Roxxie's getting a new weasel fart cushion..." The sheriff opened her mouth to protest, but Butterscotch was waiting for that, and blew a powerful, dung-smelling cloud straight into her mouth, silencing her before she'd even spoken and knocking her out cold. Unable to fight back, the sheriff's fate was sealed as Butterscotch's newest cushion. She didn't last long.
11212.title: Jammed.

choices: Surprise her now
Time for a climb
1122.content:
Roxxie had the advantage here, and if Tex came out shooting, the stagecoach crew could get hurt. The weasel shuffled over to the other side of the carriage and gently kicked open the door, allowing herself to fall out onto the warm sand, hidden from the outlaw's view by the coach.

As the coach drivers began to unload the gold and fill up the saddlebags, Texas slowly circled around the small sand dunes until she was behind Roxxie and Butterscotch. From this angle, the sheriff had an unparralelled view of the horse's ass, which was big enough to crush three of her with room to spare, and glistened with sweat and dirt. Texas shuddered in disgust at the sight of it, and even from her position she could still faintly smell the horrific odor of manure and horse flatuelence wafting off it. Still, from here Texas would probably be able to get the drop on Roxxie, though if she wanted to be sure she would have to get closer, and that meant climbing up Butterscotch.
1122.title: Walk Softly...

choices: The mayor lets Roxxie deal with Texas
Vivian will handle this personally.
11221.content:
"Freeze, ya varmint! Drop the weapon" The sheriff yelled, popping up from her hiding spot with her rifle aimed straight at the Kangeroo. Instantly Roxxie froze, taken completely by surprise. She growled and gritted her teeth, but with the sheriff flanking her and no other options, dropped the gun and raised her hands.

"Ah've got ya this time, Rox. No escape."

Sure enough, it was a textbook arrest. The stagecoach crew tied up Roxxie's horse while Texas dealt with the rotton roo herself, cuffing her before she had the chance to fight back.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Within the hour, Texas had dragged Roxxie back to town and straight to the sheriff's office, wanting to get Roxxie behind bars as soon as possible. However, she froze as she entered the office, as sitting behind the desk was none other than the mayor herself. The lithe lynx looked up at the scene in front of her and sighed.

"Really, Roxxie? I give you the simplest of tasks, and yet here we are... And as always, I have to deal with the cleanup." She said calmly, while Roxxie growled angrily at her failure. The lynx looked at Texas and smiled. "Still, if we must clean things up, I suppose it pays to finally get rid of ALL the trash... this has been a long time coming, sheriff."

Texas's hand instantly flew to her gun, but as she did so, a large shadow approached behind her, one of the mayor's thugs slugging her over the back of the head. The weasel yelped and crumpled to the ground, and the large rhinocerous thug instantly sat heavily on her back, pinning her down. The mayor smirked.

"Now, what to do with you..."

"I can't be tied to this if anyone comes snooping. Roxxie, please take care of the sheriff, and DON'T screw up this time." She scooped the keys off the desk and threw them to Roxxie, who quickly unlocked her handcuffs. Vivian looked down at Texas and allowed herself a small smirk.

"Sorry Tex, but it looks like on a routine arrest, a dangerous criminal managed to slip out of her cuffs and get the drop on you." She said, her eyes drifting across to Roxxie, speaking at her. "The bandit quickly retrieved her horse, which was being stored next-door in the stables, and kidnapped the sheriff. Texas was last seen being carried off into the night, never to be seen again." She spoke the last part particularly pointedly as her eyes drilled into Roxxie. "Now then, I have a speech to prepare about the tragic event. So long, Tex. You were worse than garbage."

With that, mayor Vivian hopped out of her chair and walked out the door, into the night. Her rhinocerous guard followed, but before Texas could move, Roxxie slammed her much larger ass down on top of her, flattening the weasel out and jamming her between the roo's cheeks.

"Now then, Tex..."

11221211112.content:
Texas glances around desperately, and her eyes alight on a tiny, rusted nail sticking out from the wooden wall. She'd been tied up before, and she knew if she could just get her hands free, she could escape from there. The only question was, would she be faster than the horse's digestive system?

“Come on... Come on!” The weasel growled, feeling the rope begin to fray and weaken. She was almost there! She just had to-

“N-no...” She whimpered, exchanging a shocked look with April, before Butterscotch sealed their fate.


BBBBBRRRRRRRRRRFFFFFFFFFFTTTTTTTTTTT!!

The powerful horse gas washed across the room as a rancid green fog, engulfing the two lawgirls and leaving them gagging, screaming and retching from the utterly abominable smell. Texas desperately tried to thrash around and find the nail again, but in the thick fog she couldn't see a thing.

“No... No... I just need to-”

PPPPPPHHHHHHHHHHHHRRRRRTTTT!!

The second fart followed, hitting the girls in a tidal wave of stench. Nearby, Texas saw April fall limp, collapsing into the mud of the horse pen. The weasel gave a weak whimper, trying to crawl over to her friend, but with every breath she grew weaker and weaker, her mind spinning as the only air her body received was the recycled bean air being produced by he gassy horse. Slowly but surely, the weasel's struggles weakened, and everything went dark...

~~~


“Good morning, Butterscotch!” Roxie called out happily, entering the horse's pen with two overflowing buckets of horse feed. Inside, the giant horse was sitting happily in the middle of the room, her absolutely colossal ass pressed down firmly into the mud of the enclosure floor. As Roxie watched, she saw the mud suddenly bubble alarmingly all around the horse's ass as she let out another of her foul farts. The bandit just grinned, walking over and pouring the feed into the trough.

“Alright, girl! Grub's up!” She shouted, and the horse whinnied happily, getting to her feet and tromping over to the mountain of food. Roxie smirked, then glanced back to where the horse had just been sitting, seeing a deep double crater in the mud where Butterscotch's ass had been planted, and buried in the bottom of that crater, an extraordinarily flat, smelly fox with a horrified and sickened look on her face.

“There's one cushion, which means the other must be...” Roxie's gaze shifted from the foxy fart cushion to Butterscotch's mud-stained ass, where a delightful sight awaited her: A flattened weasel lodged deep within the horse's ass crack, barely visible if not for the tiny, flattened arms sticking out, and the muddy, crushed ponytail dangling loose. With a hugely satisfied grin, the kangaroo bandit walked forwards, then grabbed the ponytail and pulled Texas's flattened face free, crushed two-dimensional by the mighty ass cheeks on either side of it. The weasel's eyes spun dizzily, and her face was a sickly green from the constant barrage of farts she had been swallowing, but slowly she came to her senses, mustering the power to give Roxie a desperate, pleading look. The bandit just laughed.

“Hey there, Tex! Oi, you know what today is?” She asked with a grin. The weasel didn't, or couldn't, respond, so Roxie just continued. “It's your one-year anniversary of being defeated! One entire year of being a horse's fart cushion. Ah, I remember it like it was yesterday...” The roo said wistfully, the grin never leaving her face. “An' since it's such a special day, I've given Butterscotch her extra-spicy feed today, nd she's raring to give you a congratulatory kiss! Pucker up!” The bandit's grin turned wicked, before she slammed Texas's face back into the horse's ass crack, burying it so deep that the weasel's nose acted as a butt-plug for the horse's asshole.

“Here's to a year of sniffing horse ass, Tex!” Roxie shouted happily, while Butterscotch's stomach started to rumble, a sure sign of what was about to follow. The horse looked back at her ass and snickered happily, then clenched her muscles and-

PPPPPPPPHHHHHHHRRRRRRRRBBBBBBBBTTTTTTT!!!!

The weasel screamed muffledly and spasmed in Roxie's grasp as the ungodly stench invaded her nostrils and conquered her lungs, but the strong hand holding her in place never wavered, as not a single whiff of the stench made it to Roxie's nose. As it had been for the past year, Texas acted as the perfect fart absorber, not a solitary foul fume making it past her. The roo just laughed, then continued to hold the weasel in place as Butterscotch's stomach roared again.

“And many more to come.”

BBBBRRRRRRTTTT!!
11221211112.title: The Smell of Defeat

Let's keep searching.” She yelled to the other thug, and the two of them scampered away, leaving Roxie with her secret prize. Laurence slammed down his planet sized behind on Texas’ face, getting to work on the poor Sheriff. Alas, Laurence lifted up before either occurred, leaving Texas on the floor to wallow in the stench. Laurence used his teeth to lift Texas up by the collar, and walked her over to the massive manure pile in the stable. Texas’ predicament soon went from bad to worse, as Laurence’s massive hoof pressed into the back of Texas’ head, squishing her down into the pile, forcing the fermented horse shit into her nostrils and mouth.


“Now you listen good, little girl. You stumbled into the wrong stable today. Me and Clives here have been without a good toy for awhile, so we’re gonna keep ya, and see how many of our sick, horrible fantasies we can reinact until your little body quits on us. From now on, you will know us as King Laurence, and King Clives, and will address us as such. You will get to know every inch of our godly asses, and you will smell- and eat- everything they provide for you. There will be no freedom. You belong to us now. Understood?!”

Texas obviously couldn’t respond, but by careful maneuvering of his hoof on the back of her head, Laurence made it seem as if Texas was nodding.

As conciousness slowly returned to the weasel, she had the oddest feeling that she was floating, then opened her eyes to discover that she was not far off. Texas was dangling from the hook of a crane in some sort of large wooden warehouse. She glanced down, instantly recognising the machine below her, a contraption made almost entirely of steel rollers and heavy machinery. A printing press.

A chuckle from her left made her turn, and sure enough, there was Vivian, Roxxie and the mayor's rhinocerous thug, standing on a nearby catwalk. The mayor was grinning with malicious glee as Texas turned her head to look at them.

"So this is yer plan, Vivian? Run me through a printin' press? Fer a great thinker, you ain't thinkin' too well. Ah've survived way worse than that!" The sheriff shouted in defiance. The mayor's grin just widened.

"Oh Texas, stupid as always. THAT is a printing press," She said, pointing towards another, very similar machine in the warehouse, with some slight differences from the one Texas was dangling above. "This one makes a slightly different sort of paper... So long, Texas. It has not been a pleasure." The lynx's hand slammed down on a huge red button on the control panel, and the machine hummed to life, the rollers spinning madly. Above Texas, the crane hook detached, sending her plumetting.

"Wait, no-AARRGHGHHH!!"

The weasel's body disappeared between the rollers with a series of loud squishing and crunching noises. As she passed through all of them, the villains could occasionally catch glimpses of the sheriff as she was flattened more and more, her body going from flat paper to a thin, tan mess, completely unrecognisable as a weasel. Texas arrived in the sheriff's office early in the morning, as she always did, to unlock the doors. Normally April would be waiting for her by the door, but today she was absent. It struck her as a little odd, but she wouldn't be upset at her deputy for being a little late given her usual record of punctuality. Instead, Texas took her tin pot, measured out some coffee grounds, splashed in some water from her office spigot and set it on the burner. She was in desperate need of a hot cup of coffee on this groggy morning. But the water hadn't even started to percolate when she got her first "case" of the day, wrapped around a rock and delivered directly through her window.

Dodging to the ground to avoid the glass shrapnel, Texas quietly cursed every single person in her horrid little town for letting stuff like this happen. She scooped up the projectile, aiming to throw it back at whoever was outside, when she noticed the piece of parchment roped around it. Written on the outside was her name (along with a few derogatory terms that don't need to be mentioned) and on the inside was a plain note:

"WE HAVE YOUR DEPUTY. GIVE UP YOUR BADGE OR SHE'LL GET IT"

It was written in hasty, long lettered script, and at the bottom was a red paw print that gave her a good clue as to who was behind this. And beneath THAT was a scribbled drawing of what she guessed was April, tied up underneath a loose artistic interpretation of a cow and crying. There was also plenty of stink lines included.

Texas understood the urgency of the situation, with or without the drawing, and so she had to act fast. The only problem was that Smiling Jack and his gang weren't exactly the easiest to find. They moved around constantly and had several bases that they hopped between, abandoning or destroying those that were compromised. That, and even if she knew where he was hiding, it was hard enough tracking bandits in the wilds with backup. Without it, she was a sitting duck. But Texas knew what she had to do...

"Well well well, lookee here."

A shiver ran up Texas's pancaked spine when she realized who it was. Annabelle, the owner of the tavern and long time criminal, had her in what may be the most compromising position of her life. This was going to be six kinds of awful. Annabelle looked her over, checking both sides of her, then laughed out loud.

Texas's eyes turned to pinpricks. She wanted to shout something foul, but her mouth was painfully pasted down from her flattening.

"Well let's get this sucker situated. Jus' need a little something to keep the wind from blowing it away!"

Annabelle grabbed a bottle of paste and smeared it up and down Texas's back half, then splatted her against the ground right in front of the door. Then, just for good measure, she stamped her hooves over and over on top of Texas until she was absolutely certain that the little weasel wouldn't be budging anytime soon. Then she stomped on it a few more times just because she felt like it. Then Annabelle grabbed the dinnerbell hanging right beside her door, ringing it loudly,

"Heeeey y'all! The Crushed Weasel's got a free 'round for everybody who gets inside in the next minute!"

Annabelle wisely ducked inside of the bar to avoid the coming chaos, but poor Texas could do nothing but sit there and whimper as the storm of footsteps drew closer. In one brutal, loud, painful instant, Texas was trampled upon by at least two dozen pairs of muddy boots, torn shoes, and even bare feet. She was left in such a miserable state by the end of it that it made that coating of glue seem redundant. Texas wasn't going anywhere anytime soon, she was now The Crushed Weasel's namesake.

Texas knew she could only barely match up to one of the top ranking gangbosses on her best day, and this was far from her best day. She needed help. So, after pouring herself a desperately needed cup of black coffee, she dug through her desk and found her old help wanted ad from back when she first recruited April. As she headed out to the center of town to paste it up, she noticed more than few townsfolk were muttering under their breath about it. It was never a good sign when a sheriff was looking for a new deputy, especially given what tended to happen to folks around here when they turned up missing. But, undeterred, Texas put up her poster and headed back to the office to rustle up what little supplies she had for a posse. She wasn't expecting much, so if nobody showed up before sundown she'd just have to head out on her own.

It was five in the evening when Texas had decided she had enough ammunition, rope and non-stick grease to try and tussle with Smiling Jacks, but she was still out of a partner. She was just about to head back to the square to peel down her poster when there came a knock at her door. She opened it up and was nearly bowled over by a mass of feathers inviting herself in. Standing just a foot over texas and weighing close to three times her, was Clementine Clucknoggin, the eldest (and dumbest) daughter of the Clucknoggin estate.

The Clucknoggins were, as their name would imply, probably the furthest from "learnded folk" as you could come, but Pa Clucknoggin made up for his lack of literary prowess with his ornery temper and his virility. The Clucknoggin family was the primary reason that there was no official census taken of Gold Springs, both because of their ever expanding family tree and the fact that most census takers or any "gummit men" that set foot on their property lose whatever they had above their shoulders. But while they weren't exactly civilized, the Clucknoggins as a whole had a profound hatred for criminals and so they were about the only ones Texas could rely upon to resist the bullying that the local crimebosses put out.

"Weeelll howw dee, Missy Sheriff!" clucked the chubby chicken, "I's saw your poster up onna bul't'n board and I wanna helps ya!"

Texas cocked an eyebrow, "You can read?"

"Shoot naw, I had tha paperboy read it ta me, and he said it said you's lookin' fer a new depudee, and that I oughta get my big stinkin' butt outta his face, which was an awful weird thing to print onna poster iffn I do says so myself."

Texas weighed her options. Clementine wasn't exactly a perfect partner, in fact she could be more of a liability than not. There had been more than a few times in which Texas had to cut a chase short because she ended up running into her fat feathered ass and she didn't realize it till hours later. But on the otherhand, she was big, strong and packing her paw's rusty double barrel.

"Yep ya won't need to worry bout me not smellin' this way I usually almost drown in tubs, but paw says muh stink makes the home better and I wanna give you a thank ya present, not only am I lettin' ya smell like my hindquarters but it's gonna be your new natural smell, forever!" Clementine said buttoning her overalls sealing in Tex. She then twerked and slammed her rump in the floors and on the walls. Inside her butt Tex was in torment as the fart from earlier was rubbed into her fur.

"Alright I'd say that about does it!" Clementine said walking over to a chair, unbuttoning her overalls, an farting Tex into it. The tan disk with green stink lines emanating off of her tried her best to moan over the torture she received. "You must be so relaxed, no ya don need to thank me it's all part of the job. Now if you'll excuse my I need to spread my scent all over this place." The obese bird said waddling off. Texas had to reform, April still needed to be rescued, but would she be successful?!

What happens next?
1223.title: Should Have Just Ride Out.

124.content:
Texas rolled her options over in her mind. Things were looking especially grim, with losing her partner on one hand and losing her badge on the other. Trying to resist Jack in this instance seemed foolhardy and would just end up humiliating her. But giving up her position as sheriff meant giving up the town entirely to the scum and villains that inhabited it. She owed Gold Springs more than that. It seemed like the best option was not to give in to these absurd demands.

Texas crumpled up the note, poured herself some of her freshly brewed coffee and sat down to write up the want ad for a new deputy.

~~~

Three days later, over in Smiling Jacks hidden holding pen, the rabbit in question was getting hopping mad. A lackey of his had just had the misfortune of being the one to tell him that Texas has not given into their demands and was apparently still going around town being a sheriff like she didn't even care

"Whaddaya mean she's ignoring us?" Jacks howled, "You threw the other notes too, right?"

"Yessir, she didn't even look at 'em! 'cept for the one that almost hit 'er." replied the trembling bandit.

Smiling Jacks was doing anything but smiling now, but Seething Jacks didn't roll off the tongue quite as well.

"FINE! Well if she won't respond, then we'll make an example out of her partner!"

Jacks pointed to the pen, where April was hogtied in the mud beside the county fair's prizewinning "mammoth" hog which he had stolen a week earlier. The sow was sleeping soundly, but Jacks didn't care. He snatched up a prod and jabbed the hog in the side. It didn't wake up, but it DID roll over towards the terrified April. She flailed about and tried to avoid the smelly hog belly, but there was absolutely no chance of it. The colossal pile of pork tumbled over on top of her, crushing her into the mud under at least two tons of stinking ham gut. And that hog just kept soundly snoozing, for hours and hours and hours...

~~~

The next morning, Texas arrived at the sheriff's office, to open up and check the status of her want ad. Sitting right on the welcome mat was a plain parcel, tied up in rope. She was a little suspicious, but it was too early in the morning for her to really care, so she brought it inside with her and sliced it open with her bowie knife. Sitting inside was a pair of panties, ones that were a muddy red brown. They had a distinctly foxy feel and...

"Oh no, April!" Texas shouted, "We need to figure out some way to change you-"

Texas caught herself. She looked around. She was still out of a partner, so she didn't exactly have the manpower to go on an unrelated adventure and leave the town to police itself. Plus those panties looked pretty comfortable. She gave a devilish smirk and slipped the partner-turned-panties onto her shapely behind. They were a perfect fit!

"Don't worry April," She said, "I'll make sure to take you on all my most exciting missions! That way you're not missing out on anything! Might get a little sweaty back there, though..."
124.title: Some partner!

choices: Texas finds them!
Texas does not find them...
Texas finds a note?
125.content:
Screw the danger! April was in trouble, and Texas would never sit around while her Deputy suffered! Wasting no time, the weasel loaded up her two favourite rifles, a couple of knives, three sticks of dynamite and her trusty six-shooter, then hopped on her horse, spurring it on with a 'hyah!' and racing out of town on a dusty trail.

While it was true that Smiling Jacks moved an awful lot, Texas knew her main hideouts, and their favourite had always been Black Gut Gorge, the site of a few heroic raids on Texas's part... and a few colossal failures as well. It was well defensible, had a fresh water stream running through for the stolen cattle, and even had a few old mining shacks so that the varmints could have a roof over their heads at night. It would also be the perfect place to store a kidnapped deputy.

As the sun began to set on the horizon, the weasel's horse drew up to the entrance to the gorge and Texas hopped off, quickly tying her up and continuing on foot. Smiling Jacks usually had about a dozen crooks in her crew, but the real threat were her stolen livestock, who seemed quite eager to follow the bunny's commands when it came to flattening lawgirls. Caution would win the day here, if the gang was here at all, and with that in mind, Texas advanced slowly into the depths of the gorge, hiding behind rocks and cacti as she approached her goal...
125.title: The Weasel Rides!

choices: Horses outside, lots of them!
The cows had gotten loose!
The roof above her head was collapsing!
1252.content:
The whole place was eerily quiet as Texas advanced, the only noises being the distant howl of the wind and the skittering of sand across her boots. Texas couldn't decide if she liked the idea of quiet, because on one hand it meant that she hadn't been spotted yet and that was certainly a plus, but on the other it meant that there might not be anyone to spot her to begin with!

Texas smelled the first sign of life in the Gorge before she had saw them, two dozen stolen cattle roped up in a small enclosure by the stream. They didn't seem to mind her, as she crept by, but the thick odor of manure that assaulted Texas made sure she hurried by them all the same. Just past the cattle was what looked like a fortified mining foreman's office that would seem to be a perfect place for a gang boss to set up shop. There were no lights on, but Texas slid open the front door as quietly as she could just in case. And, much to her surprise, inside was,

"Nothing." She huffed.

Nothing at all, save for what one might expect to find in the small building. A few pounds of dry meal, some odd tools, and some old pieces of work documents that were doing nothing but collecting dust. Not a sign of Jacks or her crew to be found, in fact the base looks like it hadn't been touched in some time. It was all disappointing beyond words for Texas.

Texas spit on the ground and said, "I guess the only thing to do now is-"

Suddenly, Texas was cut off by a tremendous rumbling sound. The entire shack seemed to shake beneath her feet, and Texas could barely hear herself think with all the noise. It took her a moment, but she quickly realized that the sound was coming from...
1252.title: Wrong Rabbit Hole

choices: Smiling Jacks herself?
A friend?
12522.content:
Texas, surprised by the rattling, jumped outside the small office and drew her pistol. She thought for a second that someone was out there with her, but she almost immediately saw the crowd of cows that were rushing past, deeper into the gorge. She let out a sigh of relief, thanking her lucky stars that she had been just barely out of the stampede's reach. She stepped down off the office's steps and into the mud, adjusting her hat as she thought to herself,
