"Now come on lover. Worship the body you love like a goddess." She puts her arms behind her head and gives the gecko full access to her body. He's too far deep to try and run now . He's just going to have to do it and hope that that same depraved part of his head that's into this can take over here.

Where does he start?
15523211213.title: Peggy is remarkably gentle with her lover

choices: He heads to the tavern alone.
He goes to get help.
1552322.content:
It was music. A light, whimsical melody could be heard playing in the distance, no doubt from some kind of wind instrument. With nothing better to do, Percy decided to follow the music to it's source with the intention of writing a ticket to the musician for disturbing the peace. It was petty of him, but he was tasked with making sure that everything was as April left it, plus he wasn't exactly in the best of moods.

The music lead him to the outskirts of town and what he saw surprised him. Dozens of people were gathered together, dancing to the music freely without a care in the world. Percy recognized a few of them as residents from the town, one in particular standing out as he recognized her as the owner of a bakery he frequented. She was an imposingly large hippo woman that even most bandits would hesitate to cross due to her sheer size. Those who knew her personally however, could attest to her being a kind, sweet and hardworking woman who wouldn't hurt a fly.

"Hey, Merry! What're you doin' outta the shop?" Percy called out to her.

She didn't seem to notice him as she continued to dance, her meaty frame moving with more grace than most people who even think possible from someone so large. Percy walked up to her, taking care to avoid the other dancers as he came up to her and gave her apron a few tugs.

"Merry? Hello? What's gotten into you?" he asked as his tone hinted a bit of annoyance.

Even then, Merry didn't notice him as she lifted her leg up, doing a perfect mid-air split before bringing it her foot down onto Percy, crushing him instantly. She remained completely oblivious to his suffering as she pranced about happily, Percy's flattened body clinging to the bottom of her bare foot like a piece of old chewing gum. It was only when she stopped to do a pirouette that he was freed from his predicament as she ground him into the dirt and pressed all her weight onto the sole of her foot. As she moved her leg away he was left in a foot shaped grove, his body turned into a fine paste by the damage he suffered. It took a few minutes for his body to reform, though it was still crumpled and flatted in a few areas.He groaned and picked his hat up from the grove, dusting it off before putting it back on.

Now he was certain that something was wrong. In all the years he had know Merry, she was always very conscious of her size and went to great lengths to make sure that she never squashed someone on accident. It was unlike her to so callously disregard those around her. His thoughts went back to the thing that brought him there in the first place: the music. Something about it was putting people in a trance like state where all they could do was dance. It was a shot in the dark, but it was the only explanation he could think of.

He quickly went to work trying to find the musician, bobbing and weaving through the dancing towns people until he reached what he thought was the source. In front of him was the sign welcoming travelers to the town and by the sound of it, whomever the musician was, they were hiding on the others side. Percy smiled and readied his gun, eager to enact a bit of vengeance for being stomped on. He let out a battle cry as he leaped over the sign, ignoring the squelch beneath him as he aimed his gun.

"Don't move or I'll...! Um..." he trailed off as he found no one on the other side. The music had stopped the moment he landed, leading him to believe that the musician had somehow managed to escape in literal seconds. He was about to leave when he felt something wiggling beneath his foot. Looking down he could see a small tuft of fur sticking to the bottom of his heel. He held his leg up and was surprised to find that he had stepped on and squished a tiny white mouse holding a minuscule flute in it's paws. It was dressed in rather odd garbs, consisting of a small wooden crown and a green embroidered cloak. Any anger Percy felt immediately evaporated and was replaced with overwhelming guilt, though the mouse didn't seem to mind as it looked up at him with cute eyes and warm smile.

"Good day to you, friend" it squeaked in a calm, even voice.

Percy blinked and quickly peeled it off of his foot, placing it gently in the palm of his head.

"Um... sorry about that" he said as he scratched the back of his head.

"No need to apologize. When you're my size, you get use to it" it giggled once it's body reformed.

"Right... so who are you anyway?"

"Ah! Please pardon my lack of manners! I, my giant scaly friend, am Po. I hail from a land far, far away from here; a land where there is nothing but green and the trees stretch all the way to the sky. I've traveled a long way to this wondrous land of giants and sand, hoping to share the traditions of my people with all who would welcome me!"

"Huh. Well, you're new here so it's best if I lay some ground rules on you. The name's Percy Scales, professional bounty hunter and as of three hours ago, deputy of this here town. That means, while you're in this town, I am the law. Are we clear on that?" Percy said sternly, punctuating each word of his last sentence by with a poke to Po's chest.

"Of course! I am but a humble traveler, good sir. I would never do anything to undermine your authority. That is not the way of my people"

"Well, ur... good! Glad we see eye to eye on that. Now, you mind explaining what's happening over here?" he asked as he walked around sign, showing him the people that had been ensnared by his flute playing. Now that the music had stopped, they were back to their normal selves, conversing with one another as they didn't seem to have any recollection of what they had just been doing. Merry in particular seemed the most confused as was rubbing her thighs, wondering why they were so sore.

"I don't understand. What am I supposed to be looking at?" Po asked as he tilted his head curiously.

"You don't remember? You were playin' that flute of yours and it put them into some weird trance where all they wanted to do was dance!"

"Oh!" Po exclaimed before jumping up onto the sign with a bright smile.

"That was the power of my people in action!" he said proudly.

"The power of-- what?"

"Allow me to demonstrate" Po said before closing its eyes and raising the flute to its lips.

It played a single note and within seconds, the people in front of them ceased their talking and stood with their eyes wide. Once it got their attention, it began to play a more complex melody, skipping along the edging of the sign gracefully as it performed. The town's residents remain still save for Merry, who walked over to the sign and gently picked the tiny flutist up, placing it down into the breast pocket of her apron. Once he was secure, he opened his eyes and lowered his flute.

"You see, my people aren't adapt to dealing with those larger than us. We are a weak, fragile lot with no real means of defending ourselves"

It was hard for Percy to disagree with that sentiment. When someone as small as him can crush you underfoot, you really are on the bottom of the food chain.

"That said..." Po began before playing a more notes on his flute.

Merry looked down at the Percy with a look that made a chill run down his spine. She reached down and grabbed him by his neck, bringing him up to eye level. Gone was the kindly, harmless baker and in her place was the cold, bitter looking monster before him.

"... we find that taming and befriending predators is far more effective" it continued with an innocent smile.

It played three more notes and Merry snorted, crushing the helpless deputy in her massive hand. Without warning, she tossed his squashed body into her mouth and chomped down, chewing on him like a piece of gum before spitting him back onto the ground.

"In my land, music is nothing more than a means to fend off those who would do us harm... that is why I chose to leave. Something as beautiful as music shouldn't be used as a mere tool. It should be shared and enjoyed by all, and it is here that my craft is truly appreciated..." it said with a fond sigh.

Percy could barely hear what he was saying as he was preoccupied with trying to reform his battered body. Once he collected himself he looked up at Po, trying to ignore the glare that Merry was giving him.

"R-right... listen Mister...um...Miss..."

"I am a boy" Po giggled.

"Listen Mister Po... as much as I respect your intentions, I'm afraid I'm gonna hafta confiscate that flute from ya--"

He was cut off by Merry's foot slamming down on top of him, her toes grinding him like a used cigarette as Po played more notes. This went on for five minutes straight and by the end of it, Percy was almost unrecognizable as his body was reduced mangled mess of flattened limbs while his eyes were misplace.

"I'm afraid I can't allow you to do that, sir. I would sooner perish then toss away my one true passion!" he said with a huff.

"I shall depart for now, Mr. Scales. If you need me, I will be performing in the Den of Food and Refreshments... or as your people call it, the tavern. I will make sure there's a seat in the front row for you!" he said giving the dazed deputy another innocent smile.

With that, he went back to playing the same melody as before, herding his audience back into town while he rested comfortably in the large hippo's breast pocket. Percy in the meanwhile was helpless to stop her as her struggled to get himself together, his body aching all over and his clothes smelling of sweat and dirt.

"First day on the job and I get brutalized..." he muttered as he cracked his back.

"Shit, he said he was heading for town... gotta think about my next move..."
1552322.title: Po The Pied Piper

choices: Po calls out to him, breaking his cover!
Po's music starts having a different effect on the patrons...
15523221.content:
The thought of going to April came to mind, though it was immediately pushed aside. His pride was getting in the way of his sound judgement as he main concern was proving that he was just as capable a lawman as Texas, if not more so. With renewed vigor, he pulled his pants up and marched back into Gold Springs, keeping an ear out for the sound of Po's flute.

Percy searched high and low through for any clues that would point him in the right direction, but to his surprise the town was exactly as he left it. He had expected to find it in a state of complete chaos with the towns people roaming the streets as mesmerized, dance-happy zombies. Still, he couldn't help but feel uneasy. It was a bit TOO calm for his liking.

He thought back what Po said before he left him in a broken heap, that he was heading to the "Den of Food and Refreshments" before clarifying that he was referring to a tavern. Despite the obvious lead, Percy had little to work with as there numerous taverns scattered around Gold Springs. In a sweltering hot mining town where the primary commerce came from hard labor, it only made sense for there to be multiple watering holes for hard working stiffs to go and drink their cared away. He could only imagine the damage the little nuisance could do with a audience of large, drunken hooligans.

He shuddered at the though and quickly went back to his search, turning to interrogating the civilians for any leads. His first target was an elderly old turtle reclining on a soapbox with a flask in hand. Judging by the vacant, dreary eyed look on his face it was clear that he didnt have much going on between the eyes, not that it stopped Percy from approaching him. The gecko tipped his hat respectfully then cleared his throat to get his attention.

"Scuse me, sir. I don't mean to trouble you none, but I'm currently on the lookout for an armed and potentially dangerous criminal. About five inches in height, wears a snot green cloak, tends to ramble on about music... ring any bells?"

The old man furrowed his brow in thought and swirled his finger along the opening of his flask. He did this minutes on end, occasionally opening his mouth to speak before immediately closing it. Just when Percy was about to move on for him, the old man's eyes lit up with activity and he jumped forward with a agility unexpected for one so ancient.

"You talkin bout the little feller what plays the flute, right? Yeah, I seen em! I was layin in that ditch over yonder, on accouna my back goin out on me. That little guy skipped right on over and played a song on that flute of his, and next thing I know, I'm good as new! I'm fact,"

He paused and tossed his flask into the air before jumping up and performing a triple back flip and landing his a single hand, catching his flask with his feet.

"I feel fifty years younger!" He guffawed.

"That's... good I guess. Did you happen to see where he was heading off to?"

He cringed as he watched the old man contort his body in a way that allowed him to take a sip from his flask while he still held it between his feet. The power of Po's music was nothing short of surreal.

"Hm? Oh yeah. After he fixed me up, I saw him head on over to Dead Man's Lane. I tried to tell him that he was heading to a bad part of town, but that only made him wanna go there even more"

Percy blinked and placed a hand in his chin. Dead Man's Lane was the nickname of a street where the town's most noteworthy evildoers tended to congregate. It was also the street that housed one of mayor Vivian's many projects, a shady bar known as The Crushed Weasel. It was home to all manner of trouble makers, ranging from mercenaries, to cattle rustlers, to the occasional lawyer. He couldn’t imagine such a puny thing waltzing to the most dangerous part of town without ending up being used as a buttplug. The very thought of it brought a sinister smile to Percy’s face.

“Oh, I gotta see this! Thank you for you cooperation, sir” he said tipping his hat and running off.

“Anytime, lawman!” the old man said before going into a cackling fit and cartwheeling away.

Percy quickly screeched to a halt as the old man’s words sunk in with him. Unlike Texas, his presence in The Crushed Weasel didn’t draw the ire of the patrons. After all, he was a bounty hunter, rogue and unbound by the law. He brought in criminals at the roughly the same frequency as the sheriff, but his catches were so low tier that they slipped under the radar of most big name criminals.

All that said, he had made one fatal mistake: upon being given the task of looking after the town, he went around announcing his position of authority to anyone he made eye contact with. lf there was one thing he learned in his time dealing with the scum of Gold Springs, it was that word traveled fast. No doubt the patrons The Crushed Weasel were informed of his position as temporary deputy and were eagerly awaiting his arrival. His skin crawled as he envisioned himself being squashed underfoot and placed in their filthy bathroom to be used as scaly toilet paper.

“I better think up a disguise quick, or else I’m gonna get my ass handed to me again” he said before he looked around for something that would aid him in remaining inconspicuous, his eyes landing on an old bed sheet that someone left out to dry.

---------------------------

The scaly crime fighter came up on The Crushed Weasel with his hand resting on his concealed holster. He could faintly hear the sounds of music coming from within accompanied with much laughter and merriment. He looked over his outfit on last time, suddenly feeling unsure of himself. He had taken the bed sheet off of the clothesline and fashioned it into a makeshift cloak, tearing off a bit of the edge to make bandanna to cover the lower half of his mouth. It was far from subtle, but at the very least it did it’s job of hiding his identity… at least he hoped so.

Taking in a deep breath, he walked into the tavern expecting the absolute worst. What he found was quite unlike what he remembered from his last visit. Before, there was a lingering air of danger as the patrons drunk, fought, and hazed in a way that most normal people would interpret as hostile. Now… it was much of the same, but they were far more jovial as their attention was drawn to the piano player, who was playing a light, jaunty tune.

Standing on top of the piano, dancing and skipping along to rhythm was the tiny pain in the ass that he was looking for. He was playing his flute in tandem with the piano player in a tune that Percy couldn’t help but tap his toes to. The deputy walked through the rowdy crowd and up to the bar, deciding to get a drink while he skulked his target.

“Pretty good isn’t he?”

Percy glanced up at the towering cow woman known as Annabelle, who had already placed a glass of whiskey in front of him in an uncharacteristic display of good service.

“Found him while I was taking the trash out. I accidentally stepped on him coming back in and didn’t notice until I was back behind the counter. Didn’t seem none too phased by it as he jumped up on the counter and offered to put on a show for us. I was gonna show him the back door, seeing as how we already have a piano guy, but he begged me to let him perform and... well, I guess even a crusty ol' gal like me can be suckered by cute face” she said as she leaned onto the counter, watching the show with a smile.

“The little fella’s got the place packed! Sure glad I didn’t use him as a buttplug like I was planning on doing’”

Percy nodded, though froze at the last thing she had said. It took him a moment to realize that she wasn't referring to the bar when she said that she would “show him the back door”. He shuddered and brought the glass under his bandanna, taking care not to expose his face as he downed his drink and enjoyed the music. He felt his previous anger begin to melt away as he looked around at patrons. The sight of them laughing, clapping and having a good time warmed his spirits ever so slightly.

Maybe the runt ain’t so dangerous after all, he thought to himself.

As soon as the thought came to mind, Annabelle whistled to get his attention. Percy glanced back at her and did a double take at what he saw. The barkeep was holding a young man, flattened and turned into a round disk shape, his eyes bulging in horror as his body was stained with sweat and other substances.

“Wanna buy a seat cushion? With the influx of customers coming in, we got plenty to go around” she said nonchalantly.

Percy looked around him and it was then that he noticed that most of the patrons had flatten people underneath them, the edges of their bodies just barely showing beneath their large backsides. Person in particular, a monstrously large bull anthro stood up to stretch, revealing a number of flattened, twitching people stuck to his bulbous ass. Annabelle followed his gaze and looked over to the horrific sight with an amused chuckle.

“Don’t worry about him none. He’s just keeping them warm for his friends while they’re in the bathroom. Gotta one cushion per customer rule” she explained, assuming that his concern was with the scarcity her “product”.

Percy sighed inwardly and shook his head as he quickly put two and two together. Normally, most people avoided the Crushed Weasel like the plague, but the mesmerizing sounds of Po’s flute had managed to lure innocent bystanders inside, where they were flattened and turned into cushions for the regular customers. He would’ve been impressed by Anna's business sense, had it not been so utterly devious.

He shook his head at Annabelle, making her frown and place the poor sod back underneath the counter. His fingers drummed along the counter as he glared fiercely at Po. His mind was going through a list of plans to apprehend the rodent when all of a sudden...
15523221.title: He heads to the tavern alone.

choices: "...the auction begins. Who wants a gecko skin ass cushion?!"
"...we celebrate the passing grade"
155232211.content:
“Mr. Scales! You came!” Po called out happily, his tiny voice managing to cut through the noise of the tavern.

Almost instantly, the laughter and mirth that was in the air came to a halt. The patrons followed Po's gaze and soon enough, all eyes were on the disguised deputy. Percy remained still, his face remaining calm and stoic… though on the inside, he was trembling with fear. He could feel the hot breath of Annabelle as she leaned over on the counter, her face inches from him as she glared down at him.

“Scales, huh? As in, Percy Scales? The discount sheriff?” she asked with a smirk.

Percy said nothing in response, trying his best to maintain his cool, collected demeanor as he reached over to pour himself another shot of whiskey. Unfortunately for him, his nerves had begun to show as his hands shook violently, making him spill most of the bottle’s contents out onto the counter as he attempted to pour his drink. Normally Annabelle would’ve used him as an ass rag for wasting perfectly good booze, but she was far too entertained by his nervousness to punish him for it.

“What, you think we're just gonna dogpile you for filling in for Little Miss Do Gooder? This is The Crushed Weasel, little man. Texas is the official punching bag, not her substitute”

Her words stung the aspiring crimefighter, though he couldn't help but feel relieved. While he wanted to be recognized with the same reverence and respect as Texas, his instincts of self-preservation won over his ego. He decided to depart while he was still in there dimensions, quickly fishing under his hat and pulling out fistful of gold coins that were worth far more than the cost of his drink and dropping them into the table.

“I was just making sure that this fine establishment met with health and safety standards. I'm happy to say that The Crushed Weasel has passed with--”

His speech was interrupted as Annabelle’s meaty fist came down onto the counter, missing him by just an inch. She slowly lifted her hand back up, allowing Percy to catch a glimpse of the cockroach she had just decimated. With an annoyed snort she wiped the mess off on her pants before letting out a quick but powerful fart.

“Ugh, nasty little buggers. I'm sorry, continue” she said as though nothing had happened.

“... The Crushed Weasel has passed with flying colors. Now that my investigation is done, I'll be on my way now” Percy said before jumping up to leave. At that point, he could care less about apprehending Po. He just wanted to leave and go back to his cushy townsitting job.

He didn't get very far before he was yoked back by the nape of his neck. Annabelle leaned over the counter, a lady smile on her face as she let the frightened deputy dangle in her grasp.

“Ah ah, not so fast little man” she snickered.

Percy looked out to the sea of large, sweaty, stinking outlaws before him. All of them were on the edge of their seats as they waited for Annabelle to pass judgement on him. Meanwhile, Po stood on top of the piano chatting it up with the pianist, completely oblivious to the situation he forced the gecko into.

“You can't leave just yet. Not before…”
155232211.title: Po calls out to him, breaking his cover!

choices: Nope. The gator wakes up, and she's pissed
Yes. He exits the bar without any further delay.
1552322112.content:
Annabelle as a sinister smile spread along her face, chilling Percy to his core. He closed his eyes and readied himself for whatever cruel treatment that she had in mind for him and was surprised when he was placed gently back into his seat. He opened his eyes and blinked as a large mug of beer was placed in front of him.

"What's with the dumb look? I told you, Texas is enemy number one around these parts. We could give a rat's ass about a little wannabe lawman like you" she snickered as she cleaned out one of the mugs.

"That's... good to know... I guess" Percy said as he eyed his drink for any noticeable abnormalities.

"Besides, the little guy spoke very fondly of you and I wanna keep my little meal ticket as happy as possible" she explained as she pointed a thumb over to Po was chatting it up with the pianist about the next song they would play.

Percy frowned, though he kept his comments to himself as he took a sip of his drink. He was a selfish, egotistical fellow with a massive inferiority complex, but he was still a straight laced man of justice that despised those who would do harm to the good people of Gold Springs. As such, he didn't take kindly to being linked to someone he saw as a criminal, even tangentially. He glared daggers at Po who met his gaze and answers with a smile and a wave.

I gotta out that little varmint behind bars before he lures anyone else in here..., he thought as drummed his fingers along the counter.

He knew that if he was to just go up and attempt to arrest him, Annabelle would turn him into a stain on the bottom of her heel. He thought of snatching him and running, relating on his impressive speed to get out of dodge, but there was a good chance that he'd get pounced on by the patrons. As he mulled over his options, his resolve began to wane. He had already tried his luck by wandering in the tavern in the first place and he wasn't keen on putting his neck on the line for nothing.

Still, he had to try. As much as he feared for what might happen to him, it was his duty as deputy to bring Po into justice. He slowly stood up from his seat, placing another handful of coins onto the counter to keep Annabelle preoccupied while he walked over to Po. As he approached him, an idea began to form in his mind, one that if it worked, would ensure that he could get out of the tavern without harm coming to him. The little fellow greeted him with a bright smile, as though they had been friends for years prior to that moment.

“Good day to you, my scalely friend! I told Miss Annabelle to expect your presence, so she could reserve a seat for you. I hope everything is to your liking” He said happily.

“Oh yeah, it’s been real… nice. Listen, I was thinking about what you said before, about how you can tame people with your music?” Percy asked as he stroked his chin in thought.

“Indeed. You would be surprised how music can have an affect on one’s very soul!”

“Right. Can I see an example of that? Like, let’s say a herd of wild stallions were charging towards you. What would you play in order to stop them?”

Po tilted his head as he eyed Percy curiously and for a moment, making the deputy nervous. If he caught on to his ruse, there was no telling what he would do. Fortunately for him, the little mouse was quite naive and couldn’t read between the lines as he lifted up his flute in preparation.

“Simple. I would temper their hearts with a ballad and lull them into a long slumber. Like so…”


Soon enough, the tavern was filled with the sound of Po’s flute. Where his previous song had been lighthearted and jovial, this one was much more subdued. Percy was quick to feel the effects of the music, a zen light calmness washing over him as he listened to the enchanting melody. He shook his head and clenched placed his hands over his ears, trying to block out any potential effects that came from listening.

All around him, the patrons were slumped back in their seats, their eyes heavy and their heads hanging low. Annabelle herself was listening against the counter with her head resting in her arms. In less than a minute, the entire tavern was asleep save for Po and Percy. Once everyone was knocked out, Po brought his song to an end and smiled.

“Every creature is a creation of the mother earth and as such, they are all entitled to compassion and care. That is why we befriend those who would do us harm, Mr.Scales. For we all share kinship with--”

Po’s flower speech was cut off as Percy grabbed onto him, forcing a light squeak from the mouse as he held a tight grip on him. The deputy smirked as he plucked the flute from Po’s hands and placed it into his pocket, ensuring that he would have no way of escaping.

“By the authority of Gold Springs, I’m placing you under arrest for disturbing the peace, being an accomplice in a slave trafficking, and pissing me off” he said before he started for the door. His captive tilted his head in confusion, unsure of what he was being told. He had little to no understanding of how the law worked in this new, foreign land.

Everything was going swimmingly for Percy at first as he carefully tiptoed out of the tavern, his eyes scanning the area for anywhere he could hide should they wake up unexpectedly. His extreme caution would soon work against him as he came up on a sleeping patron's tail. His attention was on the front and he didn't notice the hazard until he tripped over it. Somehow he managed to from crying out as he stumbled slightly, his free hand grabbing onto the table to catch himself. Unfortunately, his hand grabbed onto the table clothe where a large mug of unfinished beer was resting.

As he fell to the ground, the clothe was tugged from off the table and with it, the mug. Time seemed to come to a standstill as Percy watched it fall to the ground, shattering onto the ground the moment it make contact with it and spilling it's contents all over the tavern floor. Above him, he heard the sound of someone stirring and looked up to see a hulking gator anthro beginning to stir, the sudden noise jarring her from her slumber.

God, I don't ask you for much but please, PLEASE keep this lady from waking up he thought to himself as he nervously watched the grumbling gator.

Does God answer his prayer?
1552322112.title: "...we celebrate the passing grade"

choices: "...Alright. Let's go find the varmint"
"...So it's technically your fault, huh?"
15523221122.content:
Fortune smiled on Percy as the patrons of the Crushed Weasel remained asleep despite the loud noise. He sighed and wiped the sweat from his forehead before jumping to his feet and bolting for the door. As soon as his feet touched the outside, a feeling of pride swelled within him. He had braved the crime ridden tavern and snagged with perp without a single scratch! He could imagine the look of amazement on Texas’ face once he told her of his feats. There was no way she could deny him an official position of duty after what he had accomplished. Perhaps she would even make him her official partner, granting him more authority than April. The thought of made him snicker excitedly.

“Excuse me. Mr.Scales?” Po called, speaking up for the first time since he had been nabbed.

Percy blinked as he was brought out of his daydreams and looked down at his perp with an annoyed scowl.

“What is it?”

“When you are done with my flute, may I have it back? It was a parting gift from my mother, you see. Hand carved from dragon root. It’s quite important to me” he said with a slight smile.

“It’s gonna take a lot more than a sob story to get me to let you go” Percy said rolling his eyes.

“Oh no, I don’t mind being in your custody. I just want to keep track of my precious heirloom is all”

“Like hell you’ll get it back! I’m not gonna let you brainwash anyone into doing whatever you want!” he snapped back.

“Brainwash? Whatever do you mean?” Po asked a slight pout.

Percy chuckled and shook his head. He was beginning to lose his patience for Po and his innocent and naive act, as he didn’t buy it for a minute. It didn’t help that he had introduced himself by siccing a five hundred pound baker on him. He brought Po up to his face, glaring at him as intensely as he could.

“Here’s what’s gonna happen. I’m going to turn you in, you’re gonna get locked up, and I’m going use your flute to pick my teeth. Are we clear on that?” he spoked in a slow and gruff tone of voice.

His attempts at intimidating Po amounted to nothing as the mouse simply stared at him with a slight smile. The only reaction he seemed to get from him was when he started looking around with a focused expression, a large smile spreading onto his face once he found was he was looking for. Percy followed his gaze, but saw nothing but the local bank.

“Mr.Scales” Po began, drawing Percy’s attention back to him.

“I cannot stress enough how sorry I am. I hope that one day, you and I can look back at this and laugh as friends, perhaps while sharing a cup of ginseng tea together” he said with a sheepish smile.


Before Percy could question him, Po pursed his lips and began to whistle. The deputy was taken aback both by how loud the tiny creature could whistle and how skilled he was at it. Once Po was done he turned his attention back to the bank, his ears twitching in anticipation.

“What in the hell was that supposed to do?” Percy asked with a sneer.

His question was soon answered as heard a noise. It was the sound of heavy galloping footsteps and as they grew closer, the ground began to tremble with each step. He turned his attention back to the bank and paled as he saw met with the sight of a massive horse bolting towards him with great fury. He didn't even get a chance to run as a hoof came down and squashed him flat. The horse didn't let up as it trampled him into the ground, occasionally jumping up and landing on his body with a wet squelch. Eventually the mare stopped and looked down at its handiwork. Percy was but a green puddle in a small crater, his eyes floating along what was left of his body and looking disoriented. The only piece of him that remained in fact was his right hand… the hand that held Po.

The mouse didn't have any trouble getting out of his grip as he pulled himself away and walked up to his decimated body. He offer Percy a sympathetic smile as reached down and picked his flute up from off the ground. Miraculously, it managed to survive the trampling completely intact.

“Forgive me, friend. I cannot allow someone to mistreat my instrument. It is an extension of me, of my family, of my land, of my people as a whole” he said before playing a few notes.

The mate whinnied and lowered her head, allowing Po to climb up onto her snout.

“I bid you good day, Mr.Scales. Come, noble steed! Let us spread the gift of music to all who would lend an ear to my craft!”

The mare snorted and kicked her front legs up, giving the helpless deputy one more stomp before taking off with Po performed his music atop her head. Percy let gurgling noise as his body slowly reformed itself. There wasn't a single part of him that wasn't in searing pain and his bones cracked and snapped once he finally put himself back together. He made a mental note to not underestimate the rodent again, lest he summon something even larger to trounce him. Taking in a deep breath, he quickly called his nerves and fell back onto the ground. He failed miserably in apprehending his target and was repeatedly beaten within an inch of his life, but at the very least he was whole.

His forced optimism didn't stick as he heard a familiar voice; a voice that immediately made him freeze in fear.

“Oi, Butterscotch! Where the hell are ya?!” Roxxy shouted irritably as she exited the bank I'm front of him. Her arms were filled with sacks of cash and judging by the person shaped imprints on her rear, she had little trouble in dealing with the guards. She looked around swearing under her breath before her gaze landed on Percy.

“You! You're that fella who's standin’ in for Texas! You here to stop me, lawman?” she snickered as she walked over, casting a shadow as she loomed over him.

“N-no m-madam, that ain't uh… that ain't my jurisdiction …” Percy stated meekly as he tried not to make eye contact with her. He yelped as Roxxy grabbed his jaw and forcibly turned his attention back into her.

“Is that so? Well tell me something, peewee. What did you do with my horse?” she asked as her smile turned to a scowl.

“N-now hold now, I-I didn’t do anything to--” Percy stuttered before being silenced by Roxxie gently pinching his mouth shut.

“I go inside to take care of business for five minutes, I hear all this noise outside and I come back to see Butterscotch gone and a deputy the only person in sight. See where I’m coming from?” she before pulling her hand away.

“Tell you what. I’m in a good mood, so I’ll give you five minutes to explain yourself. If I don’t like what I hear, Texas is gonna have herself a new roommate in the hospital” she said darkly.

Percy swallowed and quickly began to recount everything that had led up to that point. Taking up for Texas, meeting Po and learning of his bizarre musical abilities, and getting trampled by Butterscotch (Roxxie’s mouth curled into a proud smile on th at point). She placed a hand on her chin in thought, mulling over what she just heard.
15523221122.title: From Bad to Worse

choices: They hear a light melody in the distance.
Po and Butterscotch come to THEM.
They run into April.
155232211221.content:
Given the outlaw's reputation for violence and cruelty, Percy didn't at all expect her to buy into what he was saying. Even if she did, Roxxie wasn't the sort to abide by honor. If she wanted to beat him into the ground, she would do it in a heartbeat. That's why it came as such a shock to him when she began walking away, her expression stern and focused.

"Well? What're you wait'n for? Let's get a move on!" she snapped back at him.

Percy was quick to obey as he followed behind her, cringing as he was forced to stare at the roo's frighteningly large rear. Until then he had never once interacted with the infamous crook, but one glance at her ass was more than enough for him to understand how she put Texas out of commission. He could only pray that he'd be able to find the wily little rodent as soon as possible, lest he share her fate.

"So. Once we find the varmint, feel free to do whatever you want with him. All I ask is that you let me bring him in afterwards" Percy said in the hopes of finding some mutual ground with Roxxie.

"You don't have to worry about that. There ain't gonna be much left of em' by the time I get through..." she responded with such restrained fury that it sent a shiver up the scaly lawman's back.

"A-As much as I'd love to see that, I'm afraid I'll have to insist on you... um... you know, not killing him" Percy said nervously. He was treading on thin ice by telling her how to conduct herself, but he wouldn't be able to live with himself should he allow her to murder people with impunity.

"Or what? You gonna arrest me? Please. If Texas can't get the better of me, what makes you think you'd be able to do any better?" Roxxie said with a snicker.

Her snide dismissal managed to flip a switch in Percy's brain as his fear was replaced by righteous indignation. He already had a hair-trigger temper and the amount of things that got under his skin where too numerous to count, but there was nothing that infuriated him more than being compared to Texas. He busted his butt day in and day out just to get one tenth of her recognition yet time and time again he was disrespected and brushed aside, this day being no different. He came to a halt and folded his arms as he glared fiercely at the smug roo.

"Yes. That's exactly what I'll do. If you do anything to prevent me from bringing that little snot into justice, I'll throw your fat ass in the slammer so fast it'll make your head spin"

Roxxie raised a brow as she stopped in her tracks. She peered over her shoulder and chuckled slightly, more amused than angered by his sudden show of bravado.

"I'm sorry, I'm a little hard o' hearing. Mind repeating what you just said" she asked before turning around to face him.

"I didn't stutter" he barked back. By that point he was too far in. She could beat him into the dirt and he wouldn't back down.

Roxxie flashed him a toothy grin and stepped up to him with her pronounced gut being mere inches away from his face. The emboldened outlaw couldn't even see past her generous breasts as he winced internally at her stench. There was no doubt in his mind, she would utterly demolish him in a fight. If he had any sense of self preservation, he would have turned tail and ran, banking on his great speed to carry him far away from her. The only thing keeping him from doing so was his pride, as he was determined stand his ground against her.

"Let's make somethin' real clear here, Roxxie. You might have beaten Texas, but that don't mean you can suddenly do whatever you please. I'm the new law around these parts and don't you forget it!" he said sternly, emphasizing his point by poking her in the stomach. "Now, if you promise to behave, I'll let you come along and help me. If you don't wanna accept that offer, feel free to let me know so I can get to haulin' you off right here and now..."

Roxxie's eyes narrowed as she leered down at him. It must've been a curious sight to behold: a pint sized lizard mouthing off to one of the most feared criminals around. His thickheadedness would've gotten him killed on any other day, but Roxxie was feeling generous. She surprised the snippy little fellow as she leaned down and gave him a condescending pat on the head.

"Ease up, Sheriff. I'll play nice" she said with a chuckle.

She turned away from him and continued onward without another word. Percy didn't very much care for her nonchalant response in regards to his threat, but he knew better than to press his luck any further as he followed along. He had managed to maintain his composure amidst their stare off, but on the inside he was quaking in his boots. He was sure Roxxie would pick up on it, but her mind was on more pressing matters.

"You know, when you're in my particular line of work, there ain't a whole lotta folk you can count on. Sure, there might be one or two people that you enjoy workin' with, but that don't mean that they'll have your back when somethin' goes down. Butterscotch ain't like that though. She's been my pal for as long as I can remember. If anything happens to her, I'll..."

She trailed off as she clenched her fists tight. The loss of her trusty steed hit her harder than the sheriff would've imagined. He like most people in Gold Spring, always viewed Roxxie as a vile brute who lacked the capacity for friendship. Seeing her so distraught actually managed to make Percy feel for her plight. He reached out with intention of comforting her when she suddenly came to a halt. She had stopped in front of Gold Spring's local hospice, her tail wagging excitedly as she looked up at the second story window.

"Hold on a second" she said with a sinister grin.
_________________

"Alright Miss Stanton, it's time for lunch~"

Texas responded with a grunt as she struggled to lift her head up so that she could meet the nurse's gaze. It was rather difficult with the fully body cast obstructing her movement, though there was a good chance that she wouldn't even be able to move given how beaten and worn her body was. She was accustomed to taking a few licks on the job, but Roxxie had gone out of her way to leave a lasting mark on her psyche. It took some time for the doctors to calm her down, as she would fall asleep and have nightmares of the roo's gigantic rear end coming down on her.

The nurse, a dainty old sheep anthro with comically large reading glasses, walked back into her room with a small silver tray of soft, easy to chew foods with a small glass of water. From where she laid, Texas could make out the outline of a flask in her breast pocket. The doctor had been adamant about Texas ingesting any alcohol, but that didn't stop the nurse from sneaking in a bit of whiskey for the good sheriff.

"The doctor got your test results back. You'll be good to go after a week of physical therapy. You're quite lucky, you know. Most folks wouldn't be able to walk after sustaining so much damage, not without years of treatment. I'd expect nothing less from the toughest lawman in all of Gold Springs" the nurse said as she delicately removed the bandage covering Texas' mouth.

Texas wanted to make a quip about her being the only lawman in Gold Springs, but thought better of it. As she opened her mouth to let the nurse feed her, she heard something that made her blood run cold.


"Hey Texas! You'd better be ready, cus' I'm comin' up there to finish the job!"

The sheriff's eyes went wide, her heart racing as the memories came flooding back into her mind. Two tons of kangaroo ass plummeting down towards her again and again and again. In her panicked state, she could practically see Roxxie stomping over to her with that wicked smile of hers, her enormous backside poised to completely annihilate the weasel. Adrenaline propelled her out of her bed as she ran around the room, desperately searching for a way to escape her approaching demise.

__________________


"M-Miss Stanton! Please, you need to stop! You'll exacerbate your injuries if you don't-"

"KEEP HER AWAY! DON'T LET HER GET ME!!"

Roxxie snickered as she heard the ruckus above her. Texas had always been so proud and bold, so it amused the outlaw to no end to see her in such a state. She could hardly blame her though. After a beating like that, anyone would be shaken to the core, herself included. Still, it wasn't like the little runt didn't have it coming. If she didn't want to get trounced like that, she should've chosen a different line of work.

"Ha! That never gets old! Alright, let's get going. That varmint's gotta be here somewhere" Roxxie snorted as she kept walking.

Percy nodded, though it took a moment for him to stop his legs from trembling. Getting that kind of reaction out of Texas was no simple feat. If anything, it was a good reminder of what could happen to him if he ever got on the Roxxie's bad side. He sighed and went back to following her, his mind going back to the threat at hand. They needed to catch Po before he caused any trouble.

He began thinking of ways they could better track when down when suddenly...
155232211221.title: "...Alright. Let's go find the varmint&...

choices: Villain #1
Villain #2
Villain #3
More villains?
1553.title: Ignore this and create a villain anyway.

choices: "Of course I'll help ya!"
"Sorry, ahm have to say nope."
15531.content:
"...Callie Clint, nice to meet ya!" She revealed her face, showing off her sharp
teeth and luring eyes. She was a young tigeress, a bit shorter than Texas.
She kept glaring at Texas with those poisoness eyes, smiling with glee
as she flicked her tail. The rest of her looked sweet and innocent,
enough to make Texas assume so. "I can't wait to play with you..." she giggled,
the sheriff turning her head. "Beg yer pardon?"

"Oh nothing!" She lied. "Oh silly me, we just met. Might as well give ya s'more info
'bout me!" The young tiger grinned, placing her bandana over her mouth. "I am a
Professional at baking, and I'm actually planning on bakin' a nice, sweet chocolate cake to share out, but I don't have any flour." She poured her lips, placing her finger on her chin. "It's not that I don't have any, it's just too high up to reach and it seems like nobody
ain't willin' to help me out. But, you seem nice enough! Are you willin' to help me out?"

The sheriff would be more than willing to help, but she thought of the consequences.
What if it was all just a trick? Texas nodded her head, and spoke. "I say..."
15531.title: Villain #1

choices: You allow fate to take it's course...
You manage to free your self.
155311.content:
Callie clapped her paws with glee. "Just follow me to that there bakery." She ran over,
Texas easily catching up. "This here is mah bakery!" She walked over to her counter top,
nudging Texas to come in. "The flour's all the way up there, be so kind to get it fer me."
Texas nodded kindly, turning her back around and reaching for the flour. "Is it this--"

WHAM!

Texas collapsed on the floor letting the bag of flour plump down beside her. Behind her stood Callie, grinning and holding a now head-shaped frying pan. "Thanks, but a deal's a deal." Just before that day, Mayor Vivian offered her a worth's supply of candy if she managed to bring Texas to her in any way.

Everything was pitch black, suddenly light came in her vision. Texas groggily lifted up her head, wanting to rub the aching pain throbbing on the back of her head. She found that both her arms and legs were restricted, no matter how hard she tried. "No use in fightin'. I suggest givin' up right 'bout now." Texas looked up, laid down down on a cold, steel table.

Callie stood there, licking her lips as she walked closer, holding a rolling pan. "Y'know, it's fine. I didn't need that old sack of flour anyway. Besides, I've just found the perfect substitute."
155311.title: "Of course I'll help ya!"

choices: Callie decides to have a little more fun.
Callie goes over to Mayor Vivian right away.
1553111.content:
"W-what are you planning on doin' with that rollin' pin?" She stammered, trying to sound tough. "Didn't I say that I was goin' to bake a cake? Seems like you'd make the perfect dough." Texas shook, trying to protest but to no avail. The tiger got to work right away,
slamming the rolling pin down on her toes without warning causing Texas to flinch. She easily made her way through her legs, having a bit of trouble on her thighs.

It took about 3 rolls over to squish 'em down, but managed to get through with the rest.
She went over her stomach, over her chest and up her shoulders. She took her time to
roll over each of her arms, crushing her dainty little fingers in the process. Texas could barely talk, having all the air pumped out of her. "Buh bye." With full force, she ran over
her face and laughed at her expression. "Perfect, you're looking tasty already~" she commented, peeling her off and admiring her work.
1553111.title: You allow fate to take it's course...

choices: "My washing wringer! You are a bit dirty..."
"My steamroller! That'll thin you out in a jiffy."
15531111.content:
"Mm~!" Callie licked her lips, running down her finger on Texas' thighs. "Awe, imma miss you when I send you to the Mayor..." She hugged the paper doll, crumpling it in her
arms. "I guess I can have a bit more fun before I do~" Texas made a little squeak,
as talking was pretty hard due to her form. "Honestly, not that you're delicious already,
but you're still a little too thick." She huffed, poking Texas' stomach.

"Ah, but I have sooo many choices! What should I do..." Texas had a worried expression,
knowing that neither be good. "Yes!" Texas' body fluttered on the floor face-up. "I can use a-"
15531111.title: Callie decides to have a little more fun.

155311111.content:
Callie harshly grabbed the poster girl off the floor and ran into another room. The bakery was not only a regular bakery, but her home as well. "Bettah hold your breath, weasel!"
She slammed Texas down in the water, lifting her up then putting her back in. She made sure to scrub her really nice before getting to the best part.

She entered Texas' head over the wringer, cranking the handle with such force. Once her head came in, the rest of her followed, getting thinner in the process. "I guess you can say that I'm on a roll!" She winked as whole body went through, flopping on the floor.
"Ah, so much fun!" She giggled, picking her up. "Before I send you, I need a cushion for my seat! Ahm not willin' on sitting on my bare rump while servin' all my customers!" She folded her up and placed her on her stool, slamming her plump rump down on the poor girl. She shuffled her posistion a few times, giggling as she felt her victim get flatter by the minute and stick onto her buttocks.
155311111.title: "My washing wringer! You are a bit dirty......

choices: Texas investigates the rumors about the witchdoctor
Texas investigates the rumors about the bounty hunter
Something or someone else demands her attention
155312.content:
"Apologies, miss, ah gotta be on mah way."

The tigress hisses under her breath. She needed that dumb weasel just a little bit closer to her. A moment's distraction was all she needed. With a barely contained scowl she waves the sheriff goodbye. Texas sees the unsettling expression on Callie's face and walks just a little bit faster away from the tigress. She didn't know why, but her gut told her she just dodged a bullet. That conversation sure was odd, she was certain this strange baker was up to something.

In a town like Gold Springs it seemed everyone wanted a piece of her. Bringing law to a place so long devoid of it was bound to bring out heavy resistance. But Texas did not accept this job because it was easy. She had the grit to see it through and make this sleepy little town a beacon of order. Granted, she'd probably end up arresting half the town for it, but if that's what it would take she wouldn't hesitate to do it.

Her righteous determination had her walking down the main street proudly. She overheard some of the citizens talking to eachother, and the rumor she picked up piqued her interest immediately.

"Ya heard o this doctor that set up just outside town?"

"A doctor? Why'd we need another doctor?"

"No, this is a magic doctor, uses all sorts o hokey trinkets an' chants to heal ya. Mah ankles have been killin' me. One little potion from her and a weird song 'n ritual later an' the pain's gone. She says she's a witch and a doctor."

"You sure you haven't been drinkin some bad tequila?"

"I'm tellin ya, ye should see this witch-doctor. She said she could even help you find love..."

The two citizens burst into giggles, but the sheriff was intrigued. Was this for real or was this just another con-merchant selling water for a fortune and claiming it's a magical cure-all. They didn't bother letting her know about their arrival, which Texas always found a little suspicious.

Further down the street she saw a group of Vivian's thugs loitering around, huddled together. Of course Vivian would deny high and low that she even knew these bear and rhino ladies, but Texas had been around long enough to know they were the ones that took care of the mayor's dirty work. They were muttering among eachother in hushed whispers. The sheriff could barely make out what they were saying.

"New bounty hunter... Texas. Stinkin' weasel... found again. Old coal mine..." The last sentence trailed off in laughter before one of the thugs spotted the sheriff listening in. The conversation halted and the brutes dispersed, some whistling innocently to themselves. Is mayor Vivian trying her luck with another cheap bounty hunter? The last one was still waiting for release in a jail cell after Texas handily kicked his ass up and down main street. At least the thugs were helpful enough to drop a location for her. The old coal mine. Gold Springs may've earned it's name off all the gold mines in the mountains, but there were a scant few shafts that found a different prize. The old coal mine was large, the only nearby source of coal to smelt all the gold in town. There's no telling what she might find in there, but it sounded like something worth investigating.
155312.title: Texas is too busy

choices: Abra puts a spell on Texas
Abra takes control of Texas
Abra empowers one of Texas' enemies with a spell
1553121.content:
It didn't take Texas long to find the wagon of the witchdoctor. It stood out quite starkly in the desert plain, richly covered in deep blue cloth and all manner of trinkets. On the side facing the sheriff two large eyes were painted. Though it was just a picture on cloth, the weasel got the unnerving feeling those eyes were looking right at her. Her hand hovered close to her revolver when a voice rang out from inside.

"Aaaah, I have a visitor. Just a moment please." The voice was feminine, deep and infused with an exotic accent the sheriff had never heard before. Wherever this stranger was from, she'd traveled a long way to end up in Gold Springs. None of it soothed Texas' nerves. This could be a clever ambush for all she knew. It was to her relief that when the small door at the back of the wagon opened, a petite cheetah woman stepped out. She moved with grace as she introduced herself.

"Greetings, miss Texas. Da spirits told me much about you. Dey see a heavy burden you bear. In a town like dis, few would willingly take up de mantle of de law." The sheriff was surprised she knew her. Had they met before and did she simply forget about it? Furthermore she was taken aback by the cheetah's appearance. She was about as tall as her, a welcome break from all the villains she usually dealt with that towered over her. She wore a revealing deep blue dress matching the fabric on her wagon. Much like it she wore many exotic trinkets. Her spots were intricate in design and she'd used black paint to make the ones on her arms even more elaborate, turning some into little suns and stars. The same was done to her eyes, surrounding them in an intriguing black outline. Her piercing yellow eyes darted up and down, thoroughly inspecting her visitor.

"You come seeking answers, and I can help you with sight and spirit. Please, do not be alarmed. I mean you no harm." Her words were calming, but the sheriff remained apprehensive as she followed the cheetah into her wagon.

The inside was cozy and surprisingly spacious. Texas was invited into a seat with the mysterious witchdoctor sitting opposite of her. The dim lamplight gave the whole thing an air of mysticism, but the sheriff was here on business. She cleared her throat and began asking questions.

"Who are you?"

"Da spirits gave me many names, but most know me as Abrajin. You can call me Abra for short if dat pleases you, Texas."

"What is it you do?"

"I seek to help however I can. Be it with a tonic to aid de body or a spell to aid the spirit. My spells even help those in need find love."

"spells?" Texas scoffed. She'd met her fair share of two-bit illusionists selling their 'magic'.

"You reek of doubt, lawman. I cannot blame you. Many foolishly claim to posses the gifts I have. None I've met had anything other than regret in the face of what I can do. I assure you, my spells are no mere hollow words. And profiting off them is hard when I give them freely."

"Freely? Then how do you make money to buy food and things?"

"I'm a bit of an entertainer on de side. Fortune telling and all that. Just harmless fun, or so dey think."

Texas raised a suspicious brow. "What do you mean by that?"

"Nothing big, sheriff. It's just real hard to tell de difference between a clever story about one's future and a prophecy from da spirits themselves. If I can give an example, da spirits see much conflict in your future. But I think we could have both guessed that one already." The weasel smirks.

"One last thing miss Abrajin, why did you never come to me when you arrived in Gold Springs?"

"Did I not? Are you not here right now? Or did you think it to be a coincidence you overhead those two talking about me?" She laughed ominously before continuing. "Da spirits work in many ways to guide us. Keep an open mind and you can see much."

"Or ya took your best guess at how ah came to know you were here. Much like how ya could tell ah'm a sheriff from the badge, which also conveniently has ma name on it. Let me warn you here 'an now. I've run plenty of con artists out of this town and if ah get so much as a hint that you're trying to scam anyone, you'll need more than spirits to stop me."

Abra's voice turned sour. "Very well, I see you prefer living in your own closed off world. Den I only hope you will handle it better when the walls of your reality come crashing down on you. Leave now. You came to know my name and you have it. Scams and con artists are the last thing you have to fear, sherrif Texas Stanton. There are pawns being moved in de shadows. Powerful foes looking to usurp you..."

"Yeah yeah, they're called Vivian and Georgia and they've been trying unsuccessfully for months now. Goodbye miss Jin, keep on the right side of the law or we're gonna have trouble."

"Be wary on de way out." the cheetah call after her.

"Is that a threat?" Texas spat back before bumping into a grizzly looking totem, scratching her arm.

"No, it's just a lot of people bump into dat thing." Abra replied with a smug grin. The sheriff muttered and cursed under her breath. She didn't have time for this. But as she went back about her business, the cheetah carefully picked the strands of weasel fur left behind on the totem. She dug up a small doll and stuffed the sheriff's fur in before stitching it up.

"And now you and I will have some fun, miss Texas." She said sinisterly as she dug through her things to find the items she needed for her next big trick.
1553121.title: Texas meets the witchdoctor

choices: Texas had shrunk
Texas had become incredibly clumsy
Texas felt an uncontrollable attraction to Abra
15531211.content:
Abrajin scurried back and forth throughout the wagon, gathering many strange oddities and arranging them on the floor. Somewhere amidst the rush she even popped open the door to hang a 'in session'-sign on the outside. She'd been looking for someone to play with and the stubborn weasel seemed like just the right mark. The payment she'd gotten from Vivian was almost too sweet a bonus. The cheetah would let Texas feel the full range of her witchcraft. Incense was being burned and strange phrases sung as she entered a trance. Lying at the heart of her maze of trinkets was the small doll containing some of the sheriff's fur. The lamps inside flickered wildly as Abra channeled all her knowledge into the room. Be it spirits, magical trinkets or her wildly flailing arms, the spell seemed to affect the small items on the floor. They rattled and shook, twisting to face the doll. The witchdoctor was fully immersed in her trance, chanting ever faster until she spoke nothing but gibberish. Louder and louder she chanted until the final verse blew through the wagon, extinguishing all the lanterns. The only light left was the spark of mischief in Abra's eyes as she picked up the doll.

"I hope you're ready, sheriff Texas. Because dis is goin to be one wild trip for you..." The doll seemed to hum with life, a sign the spell had worked. Abrajin went about tidying up her wagon, pleased in the knowledge her spell had been a success. The weasel would be feeling the consequences of her insolence soon enough. Day quickly made way for night and without any further incidents the sheriff closed up shop and went home. That night she slept well, but in the morning she was in for a shock.
15531211.title: Abra puts a spell on Texas

choices: Vivian's thugs find Texas
Georgia finds Texas
Texas reaches Abra's wagon
155312111.content:
Texas awoke with a large yawn. It'd been a while since she slept as deeply as she had done last night. Her bed felt more comfortable than ever before, but another long day of upholding the law awaited. These criminals weren't going to arrest themselves. When the blur of just waking up faded reality set in. The sheriff's heart almost skipped a beat as she looked in awe at the sheer size of her room. Everything was enormous and with growing fear she turned to look at her bed and nightstand. No wonder her bed felt so comfy all of a sudden. She was no more than a foot tall! What the hell had happened to her?! Suddenly she smacked her forehead and knew there could be only one answer.

"Abra, that pest!" She yelled out. Cursing under her breath the weasel took stock of her surroundings. She had the good fortune of still wearing her outfit, which had shrunk with her. Far less pleasant was the look of her gun. She'd put it on her nightstand before going to bed and as such it was spared the effects of the witchdoctor's tricks. It was the size of a large cannon to Texas, completely useless. Granted, a gun at her size probably wouldn't do much anyway, but she felt naked walking around without it. With some effort she clambered down the side of her bed and up to a window. Outside everything was still normal, she was the only one affected by Abra. No doubt her harsh words did not sit well with the strange cheetah.

As loathe as she was to admit it, the sheriff needed her help now. But that required getting to her, which meant getting through town. If none of the townsfolk stepped on her by accident she still had to worry. Both Vivian and Georgia would love to get their hands on her in this state. Texas shudders at the mere thought of ending up in their grasp. She couldn't risk waiting either. Who knows if this was as small as she was going to get. She only had a precious dozen inches in size.

The weasel hopped down from the window and walked to the door. It was ill-fitting enough to let her slip underneath, a small blessing in disguise. Texas doubted her ability to open the door normally, smiling wryly at the thought of all the acrobatics it would take to even reach the handle.

Standing at ground level and seeing the huge town stretch out before her further cemented the sheer enormity of her task. She had to find Abra and convince her to change her back to normal. With a deep breath she set off on her journey.
155312111.title: Tiny Texas

choices: ...bring Texas to the mayor.
...keep Texas to themselves.
1553121111.content:
Avoid the townsfolk proved to be a simpler task than expected for Texas. Her diminished size granted her easier access to hiding spots that she normally would've glossed over in her normal size. The ease of her task did little ease her fears however. At her height, even her weakest of foes posed a considerable threat to her. She couldn't afford to make even the smallest mistake, least she wind up squashed flat and used as an insole for the rest of her life.

She stayed close to the walls as she progressed, her eyes darting back and forth as she made absolute sure that heads were turned her way. For the most part, the town was rather scarce, as most folks didn't share her daunting sleep schedule and were still asleep. The people that were out and about were the folks who worked long, thankless hours at high risk jobs. As such, they were too preoccupied on the day ahead to pay much attention to their surroundings, allowing Texas to skirt by unnoticed.

There was on instance where she thought someone had spotted her. A lumbering gator anthro was on his way to the coal mines we he suddenly stopped and turned her way. The sheriff froze and felt her heart begin to race. Even at her regular size, this man would cut quite the intimidating figure. Just when she thought that she would have to fight for her life, the gator sucked his teeth and walked away. She was puzzled by his behavior when she turned her attention upward. Above her head there was a notice on the wall from Mayor Vivian talking about her new tax plan. Judging by his irritable and dismissive demeanor, it was clear that his attention was on the poster rather than Texas herself. She breathed a sigh of relief and continued onward.

Little by little, Texas made her way over to the wagon. She wasn't sure what she would even do once she arrived at her destination. She wasn't the type to beg, but if that's what it took to convince Abra to reverse the spell, she'd do it with little hesitation. She didn't have much time to considering her options when she spotted something quite troubling. The bear and rhino ladies she had previously eavesdropped on were standing outside of the post office, chatting it up as they awaited orders from Vivian. The road in front of them was completely barren due to people avoiding their general vicinity. Texas didn't want to run the risk of being spotted by them and opted to cut through the nearest alleyway in order to slip by them.

This would prove to be a problem as well. She didn't get very far before she found herself standing several feet away from a rat girl that she instantly recognized to be one of Vivian's goons. On any normal day, Texas would scoff at the idea of being intimidated by such a puny specimen, as she would stand almost a head above her. With her new height, the sheriff was seeing the runty little rodent in a whole new light. No longer was she a scrawny little punk that she could easily brush past. Now she was a towering amazon of a woman who could squash her flat beneath her plump rear and powerful thighs.

Luckily for her, the rat didn't seem to notice her presence right away as she sat against the wall drinking her cares away. She was lucky enough to be off duty for a moment and was trying to get as much enjoyment out of her free time as she could. Texas slowly began to back away from her, taking great care to not make any noise as she did so. There was nothing for her to hide behind, so even the slightest sound could make the thug shift her gaze back upward. The sheriff was so preoccupied in keeping his attention on the woman in front of her that she didn't hear the light footsteps plodding behind her.

"Hey Sarah! You back here?!" a voice called out.

Texas' eyes widened as the rat woman turned her attention to the source of the voice, which happened to be in her direction. She prayed that her presence would go unnoticed like it did with the gator, but that wasn't the case. The thug's eyes widened in shock as she stared at the sheriff, her gazes shifting to her bottle a couple of times as though she were debating whether what she was seeing was an alcohol induced hallucination. Texas wasn't going to wait for her to decide as she turned to make break for it, though she didn't get very far before she ran into a jean cladded wall. The woman who had called out to Sarah had rounded the corner and bumped into Texas.

"What the hell?" the woman in front of her inquired as she looked down at the shrunken sheriff.

The woman in front of her was yet another rodent but with a slightly dark coat than Sarah. Now that she was up close to one of them, Texas was frozen in a mixture of awe and fear. It was nothing short of surreal to be put in such a position, where one of the tiniest and weakest of thugs was now might giant. And from her shrunken perspective, she couldn't help but finally take notice to how stacked rat anthros really were. So much so that the sheriff couldn't even see past the woman's hefty bosom. As if reading her mind, the woman before her reached down and picked her up by the scruff of her neck, bringing her to eye level.

"...Texas? Is that you?" she asked incredulously.

"...Uh... n-nope... ah ain't never heard'a no Texas, partner!" Texas said with a nervous laugh. The thug seemed to disregard her response as she looked over to Sarah who was still sitting and looking confused.

"Oi, Sarah! Get a loud of this! It's like a pint sized Texas!" she called with a grin. The shock of her discovery was quick to wear off as her mind quickly shifted over to the opportunities it presented. Sarah nodded and tossed her beer bottle to the side as she ran over to join her friend in examining the puny creature.

"You think it's really her, Sandy?" Sarah asked as she poked Texas a few times in the stomach.

Texas' eyes widened as she was hit with a sudden epiphany. These weren't any ordinary rodents she was dealing with. She actually recognized them! They were two of Vivian's most skilled informants and runners, Sandy and Sarah Mayflower. She had more than a few run ins with them on her patrols, often catching them in the middle of a crooked exchange of some kind. Those instances would typically end with her beating the snot out of the two putting them away until the mayor used her connections to bail them out. All of a sudden, the sheriff didn't quite feel so confident in her abilities.

"I dunno... but it don't really matter none, does it? Even if it ain't really Texas, it still looks like her!" Sandy chortled before tossing Texas onto the ground.

"I guess so... but what should we do with her? We do kinda owe her a beating from last time, don't we?"

"We could do that... or we can bring her to the mayor and get a sweet promotion!"

"What would the mayor want with a tiny Texas?"

"I dunno. To use as a seat cushion or somethin'?"

As the two debated on what to do with the tiny lawman, Texas began to slowly crawl away from them. She barely made it an inch before a foot slammed onto her stomach knocking the wind out of her complete. Sandy had planted her foot onto her chest and didn't even bother to stop the conversation as she did so. After a bit of discussion, the two sisters decided to...
1553121111.title: Vivian's thugs find Texas

choices: Vivian can't resist playing with her food
Vivian has Texas shipped to Roxxie Roo or Smiling Jacks
Vivian spends so much time monologuing that Texas escapes
15531211111.content:
"Now you be on your best behaviour, Texas. We's gonna get ourselves a sweet promotion handin you over to the mayor." Sandy proudly announced whilst reaching down to grab the sheriff. The weasel didn't get a chance to flee the approaching hand as she was still painfully pinned beneath the rat's large foot.

Unbelievable, these two scrawny pukes were treating her like a prize to hand in to the mayor. When she got big again Texas would have to sort this injustice out with a beating like they've never felt before. But getting big seemed like a distant pipe dream in the crushing grip of Sandy. She kept the sheriff out of sight as she and her sister made her way to town hall. The weasel tried everything to escape, even biting down on the rat's finger. But all she earned was a painful squeeze from her captor. Overhead she could hear the two thugs talking to the clerk at town hall.

"Howdy, we'd like to see the mayor. It's related to important business, so make it snappy."

"Have you got an appointment?" The weary cat receptionist asked, politeness quickly fading from her voice.

"Naw, this popped up kinda suddenly, and we think the mayor would be very interested."

The feline clerk was about to tell the pair to hit the road when the door to Vivian's office flew open. A furious mayor stared the two down, ready to knock them dead with an angry glare. Her cool demeanor was barely holding together. She loudly hissed at the pair.

"You two, in my office! NOW!"

Texas could hear the rats gulp as they shuffled into Vivian's office. If the mayor was in a foul mood already it won't bode well for her. She heard the mayor put on her friendliest voice, suggesting the clerk take an extra little break. The cat could always appreciate another excuse not to work and knew all too well what these breaks meant. Vivian needed to discuss something without any unwanted ears listening in. The mayor hung the 'closed'-sign on the town hall door and stomped back into her office.

"Now you two knuckleheads better have a DAMN good reason for showing up here! I don't need anyone talking about us being seen together. I can't have that obnoxious weasel finding any evidence to tie me to your... 'activities'."

Vivian was ready to go on a full tirade, but Sandy interjected. "That's precisely why we're here, Viv. I think you're gonna like this. Lookie here..." She pulled her hand out of her pocket, revealing the shrunken sheriff and depositing her on the mayor's desk. Texas coughed and groaned from the rough treatment, struggling to adjust herself to the sudden light.

"What in the hell?! How is she this small? Is this the real Texas?"

"If the swearin's anythin to go by, there's no mistakin it. This is Texas. As to why she's suddenly so tiny, your guess is as good as mine. But we figger'd you might want to make use of her unfortunate condition."

Vivian's eyes lit up with opportunity, each new idea more devious than the last. This was a golden opportunity to rid herself of that pesky sheriff for good. She might even be tempted to dirty her hands on this. Daintily she reached down towards the shrunken weasel, who quickly tried to bat her hand away. With a cruel smile the lynx grabbed hold of the tiny weasel, squeezing her a little just to hear her squeak. She found herself a little flustered, capable of subduing the sheriff so easily. Normally Texas would beat her handily in a fight. She relied on never being anywhere near the crimes she ordered to make sure the weasel had no legal reason to come after her. But now she could do anything to her. Texas was completely at her mercy. A tinge of her predatory nature ran down her spine like a pleasant shiver. The tiny weasel in her hand looked strangely appetizing. First things first, she needed to deal with the pair of rats that brought her the sheriff.

"Well done, you two. I'll see to it that you're handsomely rewarded once I'm done. For now, leave me. I have some business to attend to with our dear sheriff. If you see my clerk having a smoke outside, tell her to take the day off. I expect this might take some time."

Texas is held tightly by the mayor. She patiently waits for the rats to leave before sitting down at her desk. She gives the helpless sheriff another painful squeeze before dropping her on the large desk. The weasel tried to scrabble onto her feet but a large paw came down on top of her. Vivian relished the ease with which she could control her nemesis. She could make the sheriff do so many humiliating things.
15531211111.title: Tiny Texas visits mayor Vivian

choices: Vivian swallows Texas whole
Vivian crushes the sheriff unconscious before eating her
Someone interrupts Vivian's fun
155312111111.content:
Toying with Texas brought a big smile to Vivian's face. Ever since that damn sheriff had arrived she had to be so careful not to get caught. That little weasel loved to make a big show of her wild accusations and the mayor had to keep her poker face up as she heard all her crimes laid out. Every time the sheriff managed to trace the actions of her goons back to her, but not once was there any proof. Well, until today that is. But with the tiny weasel helplessly struggling beneath her might that would soon stop being a problem.

Already the mayor was envisioning the horrible fates that could befall her nemesis. She could bring her to one of the bandit gangs living in the old mines and fields. They'd love to have some time with a shrunken Texas. Georgia too wouldn't mind handling the tiny weasel for her. With that enormous butt she could shove the sheriff in so deep she'd never be seen again. But her growling stomach made the call for Vivian. For once, she'd get her hands dirty. But not before having a lot more fun at the expense of this diminutive weasel.

Texas scrambled onto her feet whenever the mayor stopped pushing, but the looming paw simply overwhelmed her and pressed her back down again. When she finally stopped the weasel was ready to give Vivian a piece of her mind. But before she could start yelling the mayor picked her up by her head, pinching it painfully between her fingers.

"What was that? Did you want to say something? Was it how you were always in awe of me? Did you want to compliment me on how I run my town?" Or did you just want to waste your breath on begging for mercy? No, you wouldn't do that. You're too proud to beg, and you've probably already figured out that witnessing my little exchange with those ladies sealed your fate. That and the laundry list of 'assaulting an officer of the law' of course." She squeezed the sheriff's head a little more to accentuate her point.

The sheriff squirmed even harder as Vivian brought her other paw close, claws out and ready. She'd be able to slash the weasel to ribbons in a single swipe, but mercifully the mayor didn't seem intent on making a mess. The sleek claw merely hooked itself around Texas' collar and slid down, tearing through the fabric of her jacket with ease.
