15534212.content:
Seeing Molly's mooks skittering in the shadows around her exit and the fat rat blocking off the only other route out of this alley was too much. If push came to shove Texas could probably deal with Molly in a one-on-one scenario. Similarly she'd be able to fight off a decent number of her minions. But together they were too much. She had to get out of there. The sheriff took another step back and Molly advanced again, swiping a hand at her foe. The weasel dodged, but the rat's small claws managed to nick her cheek. She gave the sheriff a big, toothy smile as Texas looked around nervously.

The fat rat nearly filled the width of the alleyway. Sneaking past her would almost certainly get the sheriff crushed between her massive pudgy thighs and a wall. The only way left was past her mooks. It was better than nothing. Not wanting to dodge more blows from the pestilent rat, Texas kicked her in the shin and made a break for it.

"Ow, you stupid little..." Molly cursed. But she had tricks up her sleeve. The big voodoo rat always had tricks up her sleeve.

Texas braced herself to charge her way past the minions near the end of the alley. A solid shoulder barge should get her to safety. They might try to chase, but out of the shadows their slovenly leader wouldn't be able to keep up. It all looked cautiously optimistic until the sheriff ran headfirst into an invisible barrier. It felt like a heavy cloth sheet had been hung in front of her, absorbing her movement and bringing her to a gentle standstill. She looked back and saw Molly holding up a small doll.

"Uh uh uh, where do you think you're going, weasel?" She said with a huge, evil smile. She patted the little doll, seeing Texas react like something big was tapping on her head. Next she began to pull the voodoo doll closer to her. As if pushed by an invisible hand the weasel began to slide back towards Molly. She dug her heels into the loose sand in the alley, but it didn't help a bit. The fat rat loomed ever closer and the weasel had no idea how to stop it. Texas was back in swiping distance, now close enough to see the small red stain on the doll's chest. She held the tiny cut on her cheek, realizing that the single drop of blood the rat had drawn must've been enough for her foul magics.

"Bad little weasels gon' get punished." Molly crowed, watching Texas slide even closer. The stench wafting off her body was beginning to get to her victim, the sheriff holding on to her nose in a vain attempt to lessen the impact. And impact was exactly what the corpulent rat had in mind. Each of her greasy thighs was as heavy as a horse and the weasel was about to find herself pressed between them. Molly smirked cruelly as she felt the sheriff's much smaller frame press up against her. She took a few heavy steps forward, mashing the weasel between her thighs. Texas had disappeared completely between the rat's thick, sweaty legs, but Molly could feel her well.

She felt every futile struggle and gleefully rewarded the sheriff for her efforts by squashing her flat between those mammoth thighs. The fat rat could feel her hated nemesis suffer, screaming as she squeezed her legs together. The thick layers of fat surrounding the weasel ensured her cries for help never stood a chance of escape. Molly laughed as she walked up and down the alley, grinding her puny opponent between her legs. Even this little physical activity caused the rat to work up a major sweat, soaking the weasel's outfit in her pungent stench. Her minions just sat back, watching and chittering among eachother, laughing at Texas' fate. But Molly was not one to quickly dispatch someone she hated as much as Texas. She brought the voodoo doll up to her face, nullifying it's ability to move the weasel lest the rat inadvertently pull her victim free. Staring down the little doll the rat let out a mighty belch, causing it to glow faintly as it reacted with the horrifying miasma. The effect was profound as the weasel's weak squirming seized almost immediately. The squashed sheriff had fallen unconscious.

When Texas wakes again, she finds herself...

The room she was in was earthen and large and completely dark bar some dim lights shining from connecting tunnels, a burrow dug deep beneath an old town called Silver Lakes. This was the voodoo rat's lair and slowly it began to sink in just how deeply in trouble the weasel was. This place was notorious for people entering it and never leaving. "Show yourself, you fat, cowardly rat!" The sheriff yelled into the darkness. Bellowing laughter returned.

"Hahaha, you're a brave one to shout demands like that. I'm gonna enjoy my time with you, Texas. Don't worry, I'll be gentle with you. I want this to last as long as possible." Molly's voice was dripping with malice. She snapped her finger and suddenly the room lit up, all the oil lamps on the wall and ceiling igniting at once.

The obese rat woman sat on a pile of rubble, holding up a small doll and smiling cruelly.

"Recognize this little one, sheriff?" She cooed, but her words weren't connecting with the weasel. Texas was far more distressed by how dire her situation was. She hadn't tried to move yet, too dazed from Molly's initial assault. Now the weasel finally felt the heavy iron clasp around her ankle, a sturdy chain locking her to the floor. Furthermore she had been stripped naked. Her clothes were thrown into a corner, her weapon hung on the wall amidst a whole collection of sidearms.

"Oh, you're admiring my collection? Your horrified expression is right, those are all from other sheriffs and deputies that tried to stop me. Now please pay attention, I'm not gonna explain it twice. Actually, why don't I demonstrate what's about to happen."

Texas' body tensed up. She tried moving, but her whole body seemed to have stopped working. It felt like she was buried up to her neck in sand. She struggled to turn her head, but when she finally managed to face Molly it became clear. The fat rat held the little voodoo doll in a tight grip, smirking cruelly. She squeezed the doll, making the weasel in front of her gasp and groan. The intense pressure on the sheriff slowly began to warp her body out of shape, but Molly was only just getting started. She loosened her grip just long enough for Texas to take a deep breath, only to crush the air right back out of her again. Every time Texas let out a pathetic little squeak, making it hard for Molly to keep going without bursting into a fit of laughter. It wasn't enough to stop her from mercilessly tormenting the weasel, but at least it earned Texas a short reprieve once the rat got bored with her little squeak toy.

"Hahahaha, that was even better then I planned." She hollered, rolling on the floor with laughter. "But if ya think that making me laugh is gonna save your sorry hide, you're badly mistaken." It was hard for her to sound threatening between laughs, but after the torment Texas just endured the rat was plenty intimidating. The weasel shivered a little as Molly composed herself, eyeing the little doll and pondering what to do next.

Lucy reveals it was a different bandit that kidnapped April
Lucy reveals April has been in L'Odeur Séduisante all this time
1553423131122122.content:
Whether it was the honeyed words, the kissing or just straight up the mindblowing sex the weasel didn't know. But she knew one thing bitterly well. For all the long-winded rambling the skunk did have a point. Texas felt strangely relaxed against all odds. Even chained to her bed she felt at ease, as though she... trusted her? Lucy, of all people, managed to make her calm down. As reprehensible as she and her business were, the sheriff had to swallow her pride and admit what she was feeling.

"Ah... ah accept. But just for tonight. Tomorrow ah got a deputy to find." She said with a timid voice. Lucy frowned a moment, but let out an exasperated sigh.

"Aaah, there is no stopping your sense of righteousness, is there? Fine, I'll let you chase your little friend tomorrow, but tonight I shall command your attention." She strode towards the chained up weasel confidently. Texas felt a shiver of worry run down her spine as the skunk ran a slender finger down her cheek. Lucy dipped in for another passionate kiss, but she had so much more in mind.

Without breaking their kiss the skunk crawled onto the bed, sitting on all fours and looming over the weasel's chained up body. "Oh, the things I could do..." she murmured, daydreaming about her fantasies. She leaned down ever so slowly, her round belly and large breasts resting atop the weasel. Finally her passionate kiss came to an end and after a seductive wink the skunk let herself flop forward onto the weasel. The sudden increase in weight was offset by the two huge boobs sliding forward and surrounding the weasel's head.

"Ooooh, c'est bon Texas. Just hold still." Lucy moaned, stifling a giggle at the irony of asking the chained up weasel not to move. She could feel her squirming, twisting her head to try and escape. But Lucy's prodigious chest had effortlessly taken the sheriff's head into the depths of her cleavage. She played with her boobs, mashing them around the weasel's head and feeling her resistance fade away.

The smell deep in the skunk's cleavage was uniquely musty, robbing the weasel of her breath. The soft globes were so much more overwhelming up close, pinning down her head between two fuzzy walls. It was hard to think straight for Texas. Not just because of the tight space, but also because she had a hard time grasping what the hell she was feeling. A strong part of her really didn't mind being in this position. She was fighting herself as much as she was fighting off the skunk's affections. The smothering breasts were soft beyond comparison and though they were squeezing her ever so gently, this really wasn't such a bad place to be. Maybe, in spite of how repugnant the skunk usually was, she had a point about being too tense. Maybe for once she could relax a little.

When Lucy finally lifted herself off the weasel there was a loud gasp for air. She just giggled and teased her. "Many have called my assets breathtaking, but none quite so literal as you, Texas. Now just let me do what I do best and ease your mind." The weasel rolled her eyes. It wasn't like she was in a position anymore to stop the amorous skunk. For hours Lucy kissed every part of her, smothered her in adoration and let Texas return the favor by pushing every smelly corner of her body in the weasel's face. She held back just enough to ensure her lover would stay awake, but beyond that she gave her everything in the ways only a romantic like her would.

The next morning the weasel was the first to wake up. After only a few short hours of sleep following their long night of romance she was shocked to feel the shackles missing from her limbs. It would do her little good, as the skunk was still peacefully sleeping on top of her. Lucy's jaw hung open and her morning breath made the weasel's eyes water. She couldn't remember most of what happened last night, but the unsettling sensation that she liked it was very much present. Of all the people in town she didn't expect Lucy to be so enamored with her. Weirder yet was that in spite of her short rest she was feeling immensely well rested. She felt sharp and ready to retrieve April, even if it meant facing off against Molly. Her daydreams were cut short though when the skunk stirred.

"Mmm... That was... something else." She murmured and yawned, slowly sliding herself out of bed and stretching her limbs. The weasel breathed deeply with relief as the skunk's weight shifted off her, following Lucy's example and getting up herself. "So... you're still going after your friend, aren't you?" She asked coyly, hoping last night might've changed the weasel's mind. She knew it was a fool's hope against someone as stubborn as Texas, but there it was.

"Yep, ah can't tarry any longer. But uhm... for what it's worth, this was... nice. Ah'm hoping... maybe we can do it again sometime."

"That is what you agreed on. I do hope you haven't forgotten our... arrangement. It would be a shame if others learned about last night." She said with a sly wink. Texas sighed grimly. She knew this would be part of the whole affair but it still didn't sit right with her to let Lucy have this kind of leverage. She nods to the skunk. "Ah know. Le's hope there's still enough of me left after dealin with Molly."

"Oh, about that..." Lucy perked up.
1553423131122122.title: Texas agrees to the proposal.

choices: She eventually finds the entrance to Molly's lair.
She goes searching for Molly's lair, but she's been followed...
Reader's Choice
15534231311221221.content:
Lucy paused for a moment as she fished into her cleavage for a cigarette and a holder. Somehow the sheriff managed to miss it despite her face buried so deep in the skunk's generous bosom, but she could hardly be faulted for it. Anyone in her position would have a hard time focusing on anything other than trying to catch their breath.

"There's been some talk amongst my girls about an underground passage not too far from here. More than a few vagabonds have been seen scuttling in and out of there from time to time" she said before stopping to search her person for a lighter. Texas was quick to assist her as she walked over to her vest and fished out a matchbook. She tossed it over to Lucy who nodded in thanks.

"Normally I would reprimand my staff for missing out on an opportunity to bring in potential patrons, but judging from what was said they don't strike me as the type of people that I want stinking up my fine establishment"

Texas was half tempted to crack wise about a skunk criticizing another person's stench, but she thought better of it. Lucy wasn't the type to part with information easily, so she didn't want to run the risk of potentially offending her. Besides, she knew from experience just how wretched Molly and her crew smelled. The crazed rodent was one of the few people that the sheriff knew off that could potentially compete with Lucy in that department.

"Ah don't suppose yer girls would be able to go into greater detail?" Texas asked with a sheepish smile. She already knew the answer, but there was to harm in asking.

"You'd suppose correctly" Lucy replied with smirk.

Texas sighed and nodded. The seductive skunk had already given her more than enough information to work with. Find Molly's lair would take a bit more legwork than expected, but she was confident in her ability to succeed. She stopped herself just as she was about to leave as a thought came to mind. With all that passion and excitement, the subject of payment never once came up. She pulled a fistful of notes from her pocket and placed them on the nightstand beside Lucy.

"You seem to have misunderstood my offer, mon amour. You are not here as a patron, but as a guest. My guest" temptress cooed affectionately.

"Be that as it may, ah can't really come to enjoy yer company if yer your business ain't doin' well" Texas said as she put on her hat.

Lucy flashed an amused smile in response. The sheriff's subtle jab at didn't escape her notice, but Lucy took no offense to it. If anything, it only further spurred her interest in the the noble peace keeper, that she would so casually flirt with danger by antagonizing a woman of her status. She shrugged tucked the money away in her cleavage before turning her attention back to the sheriff.

"Miss Stanton!" She called as Texas was at the door. The weasel turned back and for a brief moment she could've sworn that she saw a hint of concern on Lucy's face. "Try not to get yourself killed. It's bad for business" she warned sternly.

Texas stared back at her silently, drinking in the weight of her words. After a few seconds, she smiled and nodded before heading out and closing the door behind her. Lucy sat back down onto the bed and placed her cigarette into her mouth. In truth, it didn't really matter to her whether or not Texas came back safely, as she stood to benefit either way. If Texas won, she would be able to return for more fun. If she failed, than that made it all the most easy for Vivian to assert her authority over Gold Springs. If Lucy had to choose which outcome she preferred, however...

She sighed and sat down onto the bed before placing the cigarette holder to her lips and lighting it. She looked down at the matchbox the sheriff and given her and shook her head.

"I really must do something about this bad habit of mine..." she chuckled.

___________________________


Texas regarded the staff with a polite tip of her hat, doing utmost to treat them with respect. The anger she felt towards them had faded into the ether, and while she didn't intend to turn a blind eye to their wrongdoings, she found herself more welcoming to their presence. Really, after the night she had there was no way they could gain any greater leverage over her.

"Excusez-moi, Mademoiselle!" a small skunk called as she ran up with what appeared to be a small piece of candy in a white wrapper. "Every patron is to be gifted with a complimentary mint. You almost left without yours!"

Texas nodded and accepted the treat into her waiting palm before digging into her pocket and handing the skunk and coin. She'd dabbled with Lucy's sort enough times to understand how they operated. As she stepped outside, she unfurled the wrapper and as expected, there was a message written on the inside in tiny printed letters.

Go Right

"Could've given me a better hint than that" Texas huffed as she popped the mint into her mouth and tore up the wrapper.
15534231311221221.title: Lucy tells Texas about a secret tunnel into Mol...

choices: Texas frees her deputy, they escape through the tunnel
Molly walks in as Texas tries to free her deputy
It's a trap! Molly ambushes Texas!
155342313112212211.content:
Though the skunk's vague instructions were hard to follow, eventually the sheriff located the crack in the wall that she had referred to. In it was a crude map of Silver Lakes with a red circle around one of the buildings. The weasel knew the main entrance to Molly's lair was in the sunken church tower. This was a different entrance. Hopefully that would allow her to sneak right past the guards. The voodoo rat on her own was already a formidable threat, she didn't need her goons to join in that fight as well.

"Hopefully this'll work." Texas muttered to herself. A shiver ran down her spine at the thought of returning to Lucy after rescuing April. The skunk would no doubt expect some kind of gratitude. But there were worse things that could happen. If Molly got her ratty hands on the weasel there was a good chance she'd never leave Silver Lakes.

With renewed resolve the sheriff set off to the old town. Amidst the eerie smells of the bog that surrounded it she reached the half-sunken town of Silver Lakes. Texas felt an unnerving sense of dread weighing on her shoulders. Not many bandits could be said to intimidate the weasel, but Molly was one of them. Her unrelenting sadistic nature and the rumors of all the other lawbringers she had killed did little to calm the weasel's mind. But Texas had an advantage. She got off her horse a good distance outside of the town and carefully skulked towards the building marked on the map. She half expected it to be a dud, but to the weasel's greater surprise there actually was a trapdoor. Silently it swung open and the sheriff took a deep breath before going in.

The narrow tunnel was barely lit or reinforced, a dangerous prospect in the loose soil of Silver Lakes. It was also free of any rats that might sound an alarm. The passage got so small she had to crawl on all fours to get through, but there was light at the end of the tunnel. Steadily the weasel kept going, hoping she would end up close to April. Suddenly she froze. Voices rang out at the end of the tunnel. If someone were to look in now the weasel would be utterly trapped. Texas held her breath, not daring to make a sound and hoping fiercely for the voices to leave. Eventually they passed on and the weasel crawled through the tunnel.

The tunnel entrance was concealed by a large stockpile of crates, letting the weasel slip into the cavernous chamber undetected. She peeked over one of the crates and with a relieved smile saw April, chained to the wall. Her deputy looked haggard and exhausted, no doubt a result of Molly's cruelty, but she was still alive. On the far wall was a grim reminder of how lucky the red fox had been. Dozens of revolvers and badges from sheriffs and deputies, collected by Molly after she took them out. Not wanting their badges to join that collection, the weasel looked around for any guards. The large chamber appeared to be empty save for her and April.

Texas didn't waste another second and scurried towards her deputy.
155342313112212211.title: She eventually finds the entrance to Molly's lair

choices: April wakes up and attacks her!
Molly's minions where waiting for her!
Molly casts a hex on her!
1553423131122122111.content:
A shiver ran down Texas' body as she her nose caught wind of a familiar stench. She could faintly hear the subtle treading off Molly's feet, a sound that she had grown to fear from her repeated encounters with the fiendish rodent. Her immediate reaction to hearing the noise was to look for a place to hide but before she could even survey the area, Molly stepped out of the tunnel and into the chamber.

Time seemed to come to a stand still as the two stared at each other. Molly didn't seem the least bit surprised by the Sheriff's presence in her lair, although that stemmed less from forward planning and more from her sadistic nature. Unlike the rest of the wrongdoers in Gold Springs, she was always happy to see the Sheriff. Whereas they saw Texas as a hindrance or a threat, Molly saw her as nothing more than a plaything. Her body language reflected this mindset as she advanced on the her with her tail swishing back and forth in anticipation.

"If I had known that I was going to have a guest, I would've tidied up a bit. No worries though... I've always been a good host, as your friend can attest to" Molly snickered as her gaze turned to the beaten and weary deputy.

"Ya dun crossed the line this time, Molly! Takin' shots at me is one thing, but kidnappin' mah deputy? That's low, even for you!" Texas growled as her hand slinked down to her gun holster.

"I promise you Texas, I can go much, much lower than that" Molly said with a toothy grin as she gradually closed the distance between them. Texas narrowed her eyes and tightly gripped the handle of her pistol. She had a definite speed advantage, though that didn't mean much when facing off against a foe with access to such strange and mysterious abilities.

"Ah'm just here fer mah deputy, Molly. Let us go and there won't be no trouble" the sheriff said in a firm, authoritative tone. Her demand was answered with an amused chuckle from the giant rodent as she continued stalking towards her.

"But you just got here! I'd hate to see you leave so soon. I've spent the whole week thinking of some fun games we can play together..." she said as she hungrily licked her lips.

Texas shuttered before quickly freeing the gun from her holster and taking aim at Molly's face. The crazed rodent came to an immediate halt at the slight of the firearm, her smile waning ever so slightly. Her gaze never shifted from the weasel though, her eyes seeming to bore into the sheriff's soul. Texas wouldn't be intimidated as she stared her down. Molly large ears twitched slightly the sheriff cocked the hammer back on her pistol.

"Gimme the key. Now" she ordered.

Molly's sinister grin never left her face, even as she raised both her hands in a show of compliance. The two maintained their intense staredown as Molly reached into her cleavage and fished out the key. Texas gestured to the ground and she responded with a nod as she gently placed it onto the ground and took a step back. Texas nodded her approval and reached out with her foot to slide the key over to her, she didn't want to take her eyes off of the rodent even for a second.

It didn't take long for Texas to find the lock, though feeling around for it while keeping Molly at bay proved difficult. Eventually her efforts bore fruit as April fell limply onto the ground. She didn't so much as stir the fall as she remained unconscious. Texas swiftly hoisted her onto her back and began to walking backwards in the direction she first arrived. Molly made no moves to stop her, though the sinister grin on her face continued to unease the sheriff. It wasn't at all like her to concede defeat, though she seemed to take all of this in stride.

It didn't take long for her to realize why.
1553423131122122111.title: Texas frees her deputy, they escape through the...

choices: Texas lays down and begs to be squashed
Texas feels a deep love for April
The spell has a different effect
15534231311221221111.content:
Texas moved slowly, weighed down by April and not wanting to let that filthy rat out of her sights for even a moment. Molly was being downright unnerving right now. Why was she just standing there and letting them get away? There had to be some kind of scheme involved, but the weasel wasn't about to stick around and find out. Hopefully her deputy would come to her senses soon.

The sheriff's wish was granted as she felt some subtle movement coming from her friend. The fox shuddered a little, opening her eyes with a bemused groan. Slowly April looked around, gauging the situation. But when she saw the voodoo rat standing there she snapped into action. The deputy's eyes hazed over and she swung her arm at the weasel's, knocking the gun from her hand.

"April! What in the- oof!" Texas gasped as the fox swung a knee into her chest. She let her deputy fall to the ground, desperate to grab her pistol before Molly could make a move. April gave chase, slamming into the weasel and knocking her down. The deputy flailed at the revolver, smacking it across the room.

"What's gotten into you, dammit!" The sheriff snapped as she tried to wrestle her deputy into submission. But the fox didn't say a word. As she finally looked April in the eye it became clear what was happening. Her vacant stare prompted Texas to look over to her nemesis. Molly still stood there, but a huge smug grin had curled up onto her face. The fat rat still held up her hands, but she was waving her fingers, wisps of dark purple smoke swirling between them. As she saw the weasel realize what happened, she burst into laughter.

"Hahahaha, go on little sheriff. Fight for your freedom! Or maybe the things she's been whispering to me are true... Maybe you aren't as good of a fighter as you like to boast about. Wouldn't be the first thing she griped about either..." Molly crowed. Those words stung the weasel. Not just because April was under her spell, but because apparently her deputy thought so low of her. Though knowing Molly it might all be just a big fat lie. Nevertheless, she wasn't going to escape this predicament with her friend pinning her down. Texas whispered to herself that the fox would understand later and took a big swing, knocking April off balance. The weasel pushed herself free, putting up her fists to prepare for the next attack.

April didn't hesitate to charge again, flailing her arms at her friend. Her swings were powerful, but clumsy. Clearly the voodoo rat was using her as a puppet. With all that said and done, the weasel still found herself having to back out of those wild haymakers. All the while she tried to break the spell by appealing to her deputy.

"C'mon April, fight it. This ain't you. Ah know yer in there somewhere!" The weasel's impassioned pleas seemed to work, slowing the wild swings down, but in that time she'd conceded enough ground to find herself on the other side of the room again. Worse yet, she'd completely lost track of Molly being forced to focus on her deputy. The fat rat chuckled. One more step and the weasel would've bumped into her big gut. Still, more than close enough for her next move. Texas snaps around, hearing that laughter coming from uncomfortably close by and seeing a fuzzy wall of rat belly. She looks up to see Molly reaching down and grabbing her head.

Purple smoke dances around the weasel's head as the voodoo rat whispers in an incomprehensible language. The weasel's arms fall limp. Behind her April was no longer under Molly's direct control. She fell to the ground, exhausted and dazed. Texas' mind was swimming, overwhelmed with sensations. The rat's hands felt like they were trying to squeeze her skull out of her head, the spell adding an oppressive amount of heat as it pried into her thoughts. Her resistance slowly faded away as her vision blurred and cleared at the same time. For a moment she felt weightless until finally reality reassembled itself before her and she came crashing back down to Earth.

The fox deputy watched Molly lift the sheriff up by her head and slam her into the ground. With a curious smirk the voodoo rat stood back, eager to see the result of her spell.
15534231311221221111.title: April wakes up and attacks her!

choices: She lets the two go, a deal's a deal
She attacks the happy couple from behind
She left a few hexes in both April and Texas' minds to be triggered later
155342313112212211112.content:
Texas sat up with a glazed look in her eyes like April before her. As she locks eyes with the fox, she feels her heart going a mile a minute just from seeing her as she began to blush. April noted the sheriff's attitude as she beckoned her closer with a finger with a sultry look in her eye, prompting the weasel to crawl over to her. "Is it done?" April asks.

"Yup. Our dear little miss Stanton is now head over heels for you." Molly replies. "Just as you asked for."

***Before April's "Kidnapping"***

April shakily walked into Molly's lair, knowing her minions were watching her every step. She soon found herself before the big rat herself, lounging in her favorite chair. "Well, what do I owe the pleasure of the sheriff's lackey paying me a visit?" She asks mockingly.

"I'm here to make a deal, Molly. One that gets Texas out of your hair." April says with all the confidence she can muster.

"Oh? And just what do you have in mind that needs my help?" Molly asks.

"Look, Texas is a loud-mouthed braggart who isn't half the fighter she things she is. She's smug, and arrogant, and thinks she's above it all." April rants. "But I can't help but be lovestruck for her."

"Oooo. Little miss deputy has a crush on the boss. Very scandalous." Molly teases.

"That's the thing, she'll never take me seriously as long as we're coworkers, and she's too stubborn to just give up her badge for. This job’s gonna get her killed before we get to enjoy our lives together like I want. The only way I can get her to quit and see me the way I see her..." She trails off.

"Is with my voodoo, right?" Molly answers, getting a nod from April. "Well, your plan has my attention. Let's draw up a contract, shall we? I use my powers to get you Texas, and you agree to keep her out of the hair of the criminals of Gold Springs. Do we have a deal?" She asks with an outstretched hand.

"Deal." April says with assurance.

*****

They then planned out everything. April's disappearance, "leaking" information about the secret passage to Lucy's girls, and temporarily hypnotizing April for a fistfight. It all went down like clockwork.

Texas had now crawled on top of April and the two began to kiss, April moaning as she felt Texas' lips against her own for the first time. They felt even better than she imagined. She broke the kiss to talk to Molly, letting the mind altered Texas kiss her cheek over and over.

"You sure do have some skill with that voodooo." She comments as she holds her new lover close.

"Was there ever any doubt? And as for your part of our deal...?" Molly hints.

"Once we're back in Gold Springs, I'll have Texas sign a formal resignation letter from the sheriff's office. We'll go live a quiet life in the countryside and be out of your hair." April confirms as she and Texas begin to stand up and leave. "Pleasure doing business with you."

But is that the end of it for Molly?
155342313112212211112.title: A Secret Contract?!

choices: "I want to have some fun with the two lovers"
"I have some big plans for this town and you're a part of em"
"I don't care to be fooled..."
1553423131122122111121.content:
(By Gentleman Jack)

Molly grinned and sent the two lovers off with a wave of the hand. As the two walked out of her lair, her smile faded and her face became serious. It took some effort for her to keep from attacking the two on the way out, but something didn't quite sit right with her. She knew little about the deputy as the focus of her ire laid squarely on Texas. That said, she still had eyes and ears all over the town. Her minions described April as a sycophant who very much shared her employer's sense of righteousness. The woman that came to her didn’t at all reflect that.

The twisted rat walked over to her favorite chair and sat down to further ponder over what had taken place. She wanted to be happy about not having the sheriff in her hair anymore, but she couldn’t shake the feeling that something was amiss with April. It wasn’t any concern of hers of course, but her controlling nature required her to constantly be in the know of things. She drummed her fingers on her armrest as she tried to think of a scenario that could potentially explain the deputy’s odd behavior.

After mulling it over for a few minutes, she found her answer. It was an absurd conclusion that most rational thinking people wouldn’t come to, but that didn’t apply to someone like her. A wicked smile spread along her face as she practically leapt from her seat and let out a piercing whistle. In a matter of seconds, her minions were standing before her, their dirt smeared faces mirroring their leader’s crazed enthusiasm.

“Come on, guys. We’re going on a little trip…” she chuckled darkly.

-------

“Put your back into it, you slobs!” Penelope ordered snippidly.

Her servants didn’t so much as complain as they struggled to carry her caravan through the busy streets of Gold Springs. Their thin frames were ill-suited for such an arduous task, but that wouldn’t stop them from trying. They were utterly devoted to their demeonering master, caring little of the odd looks they were receiving from onlookers. Penelope sighed and leaned back in her seat as her slaves slowly trekked along.

“I guess I have no one to blame but myself. If I wanted stronger servants, I should’ve hypnotized buffier folk” she muttered. Her twisted sense of humor was what caused her to target people with smaller builds. It was amusing to watch them suffer the weight of her caravan just to please her, though the joke wore itself thin whenever she had places to be. She was already in a sour mood due to her lack of customers, so all she wanted was to get back to her tent and unwind with some pampering from her servants.

It took some time for them to arrive at their destination, though something seemed amiss to Penelope. She had left the flap of her tent closed when she left, yet it was wide open and wafting in the breeze. Her nose curled slightly, as a tangy odor wafted from the inside. Had some smelly vagrant broken into her home while she was gone? If so, she would see to that they were thoroughly punished. Perhaps she would hypnotize them into going over to Mayor Vivian’s home and slapping her across the face. Then again, that might’ve been too cruel even by her standards.

“You. Go see if anyone’s in my home” she commanded one of her cronies.

The young man nodded and rushed to fulfill his master’s wish, though Penelope had chosen poorly the person to send as he was the main support holding her caravan up. Once he was gone, the whole thing came crashing down on top of the rest of the group, crushing him flat in an instant. Penelope let out a startled squeal as she was jostled out of her seat and set tumbling to the ground. She huffed and stood up before brushing herself off and turning her attention back to her servants.

“You’re all fired! Letting a sweet little thing like me touch the ground… you’re useless, the whole lotta ya!” she yelled as she kicked dirt into the nearest one’s face.

“Mistress Penelope, there’s no one in here!” the young man called from the tent.

Penelope stuck her tongue out at her flattened servants before making her way over to her home. The smell only intensified with each step she took, so she was quick to conclude that someone had indeed barged into her home uninvited. She could only hope that they didn’t go digging through her personal belongings. Even someone like her had precious memorabilia.

She stepped inside the tent and froze that the being that greeted her. Standing before her was what had to have been the largest rat she’d ever seen in her life. Her eyes trailed along her impossibly huge body and down to her once loyal servant who was happily licking the rodent’s feet clean. Penelope didn’t need to guess what had happened. She was very much intuned with the supernatural and standing before this stranger, her intuition was telling her that she was someone immense power. The rabbit tried to back away, but was halted as her back hit a fuzzy wall. She could feel the presence of several other rats standing behind her, though she wasn’t sure just how they were able to sneak up on her so easily.

Sensing the danger these strangers presented, Penelope reacted in the only way she knew how once it became clear that her powers of hypnosis was ineffective.

“Welcome, friends! I wasn’t expecting any guests, but I’m more than happy to accommodate!” Penelope proclaimed with much grandiosity. She walked over and sat down on the seat cushion by her firepit. The giant rat watched with an unchanging grin as she quickly placed a kettle on the fire and prepared some herbal tea. “Come, sit! You must be tired after such a long journey!”

Molly’s minions were bewildered at the rabbit’s cordial demeanor. How could she be so formal with their master, a woman whose very name struck fear into the hearts of all who knew of her horrible deeds? Molly knew better though. Penelope hid it well, but she couldn’t mask the stench of overwhelming fear wafting off of her. It was the sinister rodent’s favorite scent, just barely beating the smell of her own musk. She humored her as she sat down beside the rabbit, the impact of her descent shaking the ground as her massive ass annihilated the cushion beneath her.

“I have chamomile tea if that’s your preference. Or do you fancy something with more of a kick? Some peppermint with a lemon twist would be right up your alley! O-or maybe you’d like some… g-ginger… tea…?”

Penelope’s calm facade faded rather quickly as Molly’s eyes seemed to bore into her very soul. Her very presence was sending off warning signals in the rabbit’s head, telling her that at any moment, this strange being would reduce her to a smear underneath her titanic rear end. Her nervousness was on full display as she struggled to pour herself a cup, her hands shaking violently and threatening to spill the hot water onto her lap. She froze as Molly reached down and plucked the tin cup from her hand. It looked laughably small in her meaty fingers though it was obvious that she was accustomed to such a thing.
Penelope watched in stunned silence as she tossed the entire tin into her mouth, not so much as blinking as the hot liquid touched her tongue. She chewed it thoroughly before swallowing it whole. After witnessing such a surreal display, Penelope let out a nervous chuckle.

“M-more of a c-c-coffee d-drinker, I see…” she joked, her voice coming out in a fearful squeak.

“You’re quite the talented enchanter, aren't you?” Molly spoke suddenly, startling the rabbit. “You placed quite the powerful spell on the deputy. It even fooled me at first. That’s not an easy feat”

Penelope blinked and looked up at her guest with a raised brow. How did she even know about her past dealings with a sheriff? Indeed, she had approached April and used her abilities on her, though it was more on a whim than anything else. The sheriff had slapped her with a fine for having her caravan station out in front of the bank and she had later hypnotized her deputy for the sake of petty revenge.

“Who, April? I just told her to get a life and quit being the deputy’s professional lapdog. That’s all I did” she said bitterly she poured herself another cup of tea. “I’m assuming you came here for a reason pertaining to her? What, did she like, come over and beg to be your slave or something? You’d be amazed at how many folks secretly want to be someone else’s property”

“She came to me and brokered a deal to get rid of the sheriff. Seems like she’s been pining for her for some time and she wanted me to cast a spell that would make her reciprocate those feelings. I thought it was pretty unusual, but what really made me question it was how she described Texas. ‘smug, arrogant, and thinks she’s above it all’ were her exact words”

Penelope blushed and rubbed her arm in embarrassment. Texas’ fine had left her feeling more than a little sour as she brought the deputy under her thrall. Little did she know, her angered ranting had taken root in April’s mind. All April’s talk of Texas being a paper tiger and being all talk was a result of Penelope accidentally planting such thoughts into her head.

“Alright, maybe I might’ve let some stuff slip when I was doing the deed. What of it?” she asked curiously.

Molly grinned and leaned down, her crazed, bloodshot eyes sending chills down her spine.

“Isn’t it obvious?” she asked with a sneer.
1553423131122122111121.title: She lets the two go, a deal's a deal

choices: Molly uses her hold on Texas to command the sheriff to come to her
Molly thinks Vivian might be involved in this plot too
With Penelope gone, the spell on April fades
15534231311221221111213.content:
"I'm not a fan of being used for someone else's dirty work." Molly spoke slowly and threateningly.

The fat rat had little patience for the machinations of people like Penelope or Vivian. Texas was hers to deal with and anybody that got in her way would rue the day they were born. And if they felt she was taking too much time scheming and not enough time dealing with the weasel she would send them a chilling message to stay out of her way, usually by making some of their henchmen disappear. With her temper already frayed she furrowed her brow even more when the rabbit started talking again.

"What the hell are you talking about? I put a spell on April, not you."

"Mhm, and you didn't think I'd notice?" A scowl formed on Molly's face. Was Penelope really going to lie about her actions right to her face?

"Notice what? You being your paranoid self again?" The rabbit snapped back, trying her best to keep her nerves in check.

"Of all the ways April could've done this, she went straight for the single most dangerous adversary in a thousand mile radius. So many others would happily play along, but I could just as easily have dismissed her deal and killed her. She's smart enough to know that too. But something in her made her come to me. And I'll be damned if it was her own volition. Which leads me back to you..."

Penelope gulped. She didn't like where this was going, but she had nowhere to go.

"You've got a reputation to keep up, so you can't exactly go around dispatching lawbringers, even in these parts. So you figured why not send those two idiots to Molly. She wouldn't mind adding some more marks to her tally, right?"

"If I wanted them to kill themselves by your hand, why would I have April try to make a deal with you? Why not send her your way begging to be snuffed out?" The rabbit stammered, but Molly's glare just got fouler.

"Because you knew I'd be suspicious to say the very least if that were to happen. This way you hoped your interference would go unnoticed. And because I bet you let Vivian in on this little scheme too. What's the reward, hm? The sheriff's office? You get all the benefits while I clean up the mess for you. Well, don't you worry your fluffy little head any longer. I'll make sure you won't need to deal with this mess for another minute."

The hypnotist breathed a sigh of relief before realizing Molly's intent. The fat rat stood up and let rip a monstrous fart. Even her rats struggled to keep the entrance blocked whilst Penelope nearly doubled over. The rabbit fell to the ground, staring up at the rat now looming over her.

"Tea always gives me the worst gas..." Molly chuckled darkly before turning around and presenting her enormous backside to the downed rabbit. Penelope's eyes grew wide and she tried to crawl to safety, but it was far too late. With a large WHUMP Molly sat herself down. The hypnotist's scrawny frame disappeared completely underneath the blubbery mass. Subtle squelches could be heard as Penelope was squashed flat beneath the fat rat's domineering butt. Several more small farts escaped, adding to the rabbit's overwhelming misery.

As the rat sat there doing what she was most feared for doubts began to spring up. What if Penelope was right and this was all just a huge coincidence? With a smile Molly shrugged those thoughts away. So what if she didn't orchestrate April's actions, right now this was just fun to do. But mere casual cruelty didn't feel like enough yet. It was time to send Gold Springs a terrifying reminder of what happens when you mess with the voodoo rat.

The hypnotist rabbit was given a small reprieve when the massive mountaint of assflesh lifted up. For a moment it felt like she would be plastered to it, squashed into a barely recognizable sheet. But soon after she was presented with perhaps the only thing more terrifying than Molly's rear: The rat's twitching asshole.

Molly parted her asscheeks wide, their lardy mass no longer concealing her backdoor. Tattooed on each asscheek was a tally. Deputies on the left, sheriffs on the right. Each mark representing the end of another lawbringer. Penelope wouldn't even be worth counting in this grisly scoreboard, but the voodoo rat was going to savour this moment all the same. She aimed as best she could and sat down again, the fetid hole pushed right up against the rabbit's squashed face.

In the darkness underneath the rat's butt Penelope couldn't see a thing, but she knew what was ahead of her. A rancid tunnel full of the worst stench imaginable. Molly reached down into her asscrack and began to push the flattened rabbit inside. Bit by bit the squashed body of Penelope was crammed into the horrifying passage. After a while the voodoo rat's bowels seemed to try and assist in the cruel act, pulling the hypnotist in deeper. In mere minutes there wasn't a trace left of Penelope and with a satisfied smile the fat rat stood up. She would never again be bothered by the hypnotist's crazy schemes.

Outside Penelope's followers were slowly waking up. Being 'fired' and their mistress' waning power led to them steadily regaining their bearings. The first thing they did with their newfound free will was scatter in all directions when Molly came out of the tent. The voodoo rat was unconcerned by them. She had her sights set elsewhere.
15534231311221221111213.title: "I don't care to be fooled..."

choices: Vivian tries to cut a deal with Molly.
Vivian escapes via a trap door beneath her desk.
Someone comes to her aid.
155342313112212211112132.content:
Destroying Texas would take a backseat for the time being. It was imperative to Molly that she seek out the perpetrator of this scheme and punish them for their hubris. Granted, she had no real way of knowing whether or not the mayor was involved in Penelope’s pathetic ploy, but there was no harm in checking. Well… no harm to her at least. She stomped away from the tent, her minions tailing behind in manic glee. When their master was on the warpath, nothing short of divine intervention could save the poor soul unfortunate enough to cross her path. Regardless of the mayor’s innocence, they were going to see a show.

-----

“Now April, are you sure about this? Once it’s signed, there’s no turning back” Vivian asked the smiling deputy with frained concern. In her hand she held a letter of resignation, signed by both Texas and April. All that was needed to make it official was for it to be signed and notarized by the mayor herself. As happy as it made the corrupt mynx, she wanted to test the waters a bit and gauge just how dead set April was about retiring.

“It’s all fine, Miss Vivian. I know we’ve had our differences in the past, but me and Texas are ready to move on from all that. This job has taken its toll on the both of us and we wanna enjoy each other’s company while we’ve still got our health, ya know?” she said with a weary smile.

“Well… if that’s what you two want, I see no reason to stop you” Vivian said with a heavy sigh before signing her name and stamping her approval onto the letter. She could barely contain her mirth, but she managed to keep a straight face as they shook hands and April exited her office. After all the time and money she’d spent in trying to get rid of those two busybodies, they just up and quit. Not only that, but they sign a contract that keeps them from ever returning to their posts! Once she was sure the former deputy was out of hearshot, she let out an ecstatic cry and threw her hands into the air in glee.

“Oh, I’ve waited so long for this day…! It’s a shame that I couldn’t have done the two in myself though… ah well. Maybe some other bleeding heart lawman will try to pick up the slack. Speaking of which…” she trailed off as she reached into the nearest cabinet for a form she’d been saving for this very occasion. It was a form that when enacted, would appoint Georgia as Gold Spring’s new sheriff.

“I’d better send word to that meathead before people start causing a ruckus” she said as she walked over to her door and peeked her head out to the hall leading to the front desk. “Susan! Sent a word out to Georgia that I need her in my office ASAP! Tell her it’s a matter of her promotion!” she shouted before shutting her door. In her excitement, she didn’t bother waiting for her secretary call back with her usual response of “right away, Miss Vivian”. Had she done so, her response would’ve been met with silence as her secretary wasn’t at her post.
The poor woman had no time to prepare as she grabbed from her seat and tossed to the ground, her face quickly being buried deep in the sweaty asscrack of one of Molly’s large bottomed minions. The only warning she heard was a subtle creak a minute after April had left and shut the door behind her. She had looked up and was confused to find the door slightly agape, her nose curling at the pungent odor that suddenly appeared. After that, everything went black and she woke up to the nightmarish hell of stinking rat ass.

While she was enduring this torment, her employer was hard at work thinking up new ways to profit off of her sudden good fortune. There were a number of good business ventures that she had hoped to dip her toe into, but Texas had the eyes of a hawk and could spot chicanery a mile away. With her out of the picture, her future prospects were looking brighter than ever.

Her enthusiasm wasn’t to last, however. Her enthusiasm was dropped in an instant as an unfamiliar feeling washed over her. Those who knew Vivian were well aware of how dangerous she was and one of the things that made her so dangerous was her completely unflappable nature. Her pride in her own criminal genius was such that she always maintained her cool, even in the most tense situations. That said, it was hard to fight one’s innate instincts when faced with overwhelming peril. The mayor was experiencing such a moment, her body rigid and sweat pouring from her brow as her heart raced. She could feel it. Danger was present in the room with her and it wasn’t something that she could easily think her way out of.

Summoning all the bravery she could muster, the mayor slowly walked over to her desk and took a seat, her eyes shut for a moment as she took in a deep breath. Her nose curled at the horrendous scent that had suddenly appeared in her office, but she remained stoic despite it. She couldn’t show weakness. She couldn’t show that she was afraid. She opened her eyes and was unsurprised to the hulking rodent known as Molly sitting across from her, her enormous rear crushing the chair beneath her into pulp.

“I assume you have a good reason for being here” Vivian stated, her voice smooth and calm. Acting too tough would only serve to annoy Molly and capitulating would insite her sadistic bloodlust. Good or bad, the rodent was looking for a reaction.

“Nothing more than a hunch, really. Someone stuck their nose into my business. I don’t care for that” Molly said as her crazed eyes bore into the mayors.

“And you believe that I’m involved?” Vivian asked as she met her gaze with unwavering stoicism.

“Like I said, it’s just a hunch. The thing is, my hunches are never wrong. Well… save for that one time… see, I had a hunch that I could drive a man to madness by farting in his face for an hour…” she said before slowly leaning in, her cruel smirk widening into a frightening smile. “It only took ten minutes”

“Impressive” Vivian said before standing up from her desk and walking over to the window overlooking the town. Molly assumed that she was about to take her chances jump, but the mynx was simply retrieving a half empty glass of whiskey that she had left unattended. Her brazen display left the sinister rat rather bemused. She was certain that her cool and calm demeanor was nothing more than an act, but even she had to be impressed with her ability to maintain it in the face of impending doom.

“Let’s say that I am involved” Vivian began after taking a swig of her glass. “I assume your reaction would be to either snuff me out or torture me for weeks until I’m begging to have my life ended. Am I right?”

“Ah, so you’re familiar with my work then” Molly said with a snicker.

“Of course. Your name carries a lot of weight around these parts. A kill count of law enforcers well into the double digits and the only person in the history of Gold Springs to have ever been deemed ‘too dangerous to pursue.’ Not many criminals can boast the record you possess”

“Flattery with get you nowhere, mayor~” Molly said with an unsettling giggle. Her smile widened and her eyes narrowed as she leaned against the desk. “Although that brings me back to the hypothetical you put forth. You know who I am, you know what I do, and yet you saw fit to try and make me a cog in your insipid little plan. You’re no fool, I know you’re weren’t so stupid to have assume that I wouldn’t follow the trail back to you, even if there was no trail to follow”

Vivian said nothing as she took her seat back at the desk, her glass now empty as she set it to the side. The rodent cast an enormous shadow over her and she could see the eagerness in her eyes. If she truly felt slighted for being manipulated, it didn’t show in the slightest.

“I’m gonna humor you and assume that you planned for this exact scenario. What comes next? Do you have something to say that’ll sway me into sparing your pathetic life? Or maybe you called for some backup beforehand? I’m dying to know”

Vivian frowned and rested her head on her tented fingers. If there was a time to act, now was the time.
155342313112212211112132.title: Molly thinks Vivian might be involved in this p...

choices: Molly charges after Vivian by herself
Molly puts a curse on Vivian
Molly uses her control of Texas to track Vivian down
1553423131122122111121323.content:
The slightest of smiles slipped onto Vivian's expression as the door to her office burst open and a dozen of her helpers stormed in. For the first time she saw genuine surprise on Molly's face. Even with all her voodoo mystics she didn't see this one coming it would seem. But the mayor was prepared and ready to act. It was easy to think that the sly lynx had been outmaneuvered, but she always had a backup plan ready. She did few things idly, and drinking whiskey was not among them. Her henchmen had kept a close eye on the window of her office, checking at all times for a sign. Half a glass of booze meant danger, finishing the drink meant attack now. And so they had charged, subduing the rat's minions through sheer numbers and entering the office to even the odds.

"For what it's worth, I didn't have anything to do with those two dunderheads seeking you out. I don't know what possessed them, but I'll gladly profit of the situation. But since you do not seem to be interested in reason, we'll have to do this the hard way." Vivian sneered, watching Molly's anger grow. The voodoo rat was ready to decimate that arrogant bitch, but the sounds of a dozen boots storming towards her demanded her more immediate attention.

"You picked the wrong fight." She spoke, a second deep voice echoing alongside hers. It sent a shiver of fear down the rats' spines, but they were more afraid of what Vivian did to dissenters. Molly would soon fix that.

The first rat lunged at her, brandishing a knife. With reflexes far faster than anyone would expect from someone as fat as Molly she grabbed him out of the air. The voodoo rat easily stood three times as tall as the struggling mook, lifting him up high for all to see. Then she dropped him to the ground, only to swing her huge gut forwards. With a massive dry slap the rotund belly slammed into the falling rat, launching it back to the office entrance. The heavy impact propelled him with enough force to crash right through the door, leaving it in splinters and the rat unconscious.

The others all drew their guns, but Molly raised her hands towards them. She let out a lengthy burp, seemingly speaking some dark language at the same time. The henchmen watched in horror as the barrels of their weapons began to droop, the metal turning as soft as butter in their hands. By now their spirits were beginning to waver, but they knew Vivian's punishment for their failure was even steeper than this. They stood the line, rushing the voodoo rat in an attempt to overwhelm her.

"Pitiful." Molly sneered, grabbing the frontrunner of this valiant charge and lifting him to her face. She unleashed another burp on the squirming figure, making him twitch and convulse, before throwing him aside. The henchman curled up on the floor, shivering and crying in the fetal position.

The next rat in her grasp was wedged beneath her armpit and left to marinate in her vile sweat whilst the fat rat worked on the others. Inflicting nightmares one at a time would take too long. She needed something to deal with all of them right now. A cruel smirk spread from ear to ear as Molly plucked a feather from her hat. Darkness enveloped her fingers, siphoning into the mundane feather and infusing it with unknown energies. She flung her weapon into the middle of the room where it stuck into the floorboards like an arrow. The henchmen all took an apprehensive step back before the feather began to hum, radiating with power.

"You've really fucked up now!" She cackled sadistically. The strange voodoo was drawing the rats towards it. Not through seduction, but by sheer force. They tried to resist and run, but the tenebrous aura pulled them closer. None were spared, not even the rat that was incapacitated by the door or the whimpering mess in the corner. All were drawn together into a squirming heap. Molly walked up to her pile of victims and laughed. She threw the one she had wedged under her arm in with the rest. The henchmen began to squeak for mercy when she turned around and presented her enormous ass to them. It became chillingly clear what she had in mind and none of them could stop it.

The whole building shook as Molly slammed her ass down, squashing all of the scrawny henchmen at once. Slowly she ground her butt from side to side, producing a wet squelch as the mass of flattened rat moved beneath her. She forcefully rubbed them into the floorboards. When she stood up the rats were a uniform mass of grey, their terrified eyes floating on top and staring silently as the voodoo rat was eager to dispense more punishment. Molly jumped up as far as her powers could carry her enormous mass and crashed down on the henchmen again. This was no longer a fight, this was just to sate her sadistic urges and to send a message to all who might think about opposing her.

The floor below her creaked, the thick wooden structure struggling to deal with the impact of literal tons of ass. One last time Molly got up and jumped onto her victims. But that was too much. The floorboards bent and splintered, sending the rat and squashed pile of henchmen tumbling down to the ground floor. Vivian's assistant had already cleared the building and most of the voodoo rat's minions were out of the way when they saw the cracks forming in the ceiling above them. The fall did little to hurt Molly, but her victims were given another torturous squashing. Even the fat rat felt that it was getting a bit gratuitous, but as her evil desires were slaked her attention was drawn back to something else. Where the hell was Vivian?!

"Son of a..." Molly growled. She had fallen for the most simple diversion there was. The lynx had snuck out during her playtime with those pathetic henchmen. By now she was probably on a horse and putting as much distance between the two of them as possible. As punishment she let out a horrifying fart onto the rats beneath her. Whether the mayor had anything to do with these dealings didn't matter anymore. She would see that damn bitch suffering and begging for mercy.
1553423131122122111121323.title: Henchmen to the rescue!

choices: Texas leads her to a mansion outside of town.
Texas leads her to an abandoned mine.
Texas leads her to The Crushed Weasel.
15534231311221221111213233.content:
Molly’s thick tail lashed about violently, destroying every piece of furniture in her immediate vicinity as her eye twitched in an erratic manner. In her haste to punish the mayor, she had underestimated her craftiness. Now she was stuck with no leads and her minions were in no condition to perform their usual duties, the collapsing of the ceiling leaving them trapped in the rubble. The malicious rat wouldn’t be deterred as once someone was in her sights, she would chase them down the ends of the earth until they were no more. Still, without the aid of her minions, tracking Vivian down would take more time than she was willing to spare.

Just when it seemed that all was lost, she was hit with a sudden spark of inspiration. From the corner of her eye, she found a tattered photo laying in the ruins of the waiting area. It was a profile shot of the former sheriff Texas, her smiling face lying in the center of a dart board. A crazed grin spread along her face and without a moment of hesitation, she stormed out of the mayor’s office and into the streets. All onlookers were quick to scatter at the mere sight of her. Luckily for them, she only had on destination in mind.

__________


“Ah’m really gonna miss this place. Had a lotta good memories sittin’ in this here chair” Texas said as she rubbed her hand across her desk. Her and April had gone to work cleaning out their office of their belongings and making sure that it was prepped and ready for their eventual replacements. She had been reluctant to leave at first given how long she’d resided their, though Vivian had been kind enough to provide the two of them with suitable housing on a decent sized plot of land as a gesture of good will.

“Yeah, like the time Georgia had her goons stuff you into the seat padding?” April called from the other room.

“Hey, ah never said they were all good” Texas called back with a chuckle. Even her most horrid of memories seemed quaint in hindsight. She thought back to all the times she had been stomped on, chewed up, sat on, and flattened, and all she could do was smile. She couldn’t bring herself to feel any negative emotions regarding all of that. After all, it did lead her to working with the woman she loved more than anything in the world. How, she wondered, did it take her so long to realize how she really felt about her?

A familiar scent brought her back to the present. It was a nose curling odor that made her fair stand on end, and yet… she found it oddly intoxicating. She turned and was pleasantly surprised to find Molly standing inches away from her. The rat’s hex had completely taken root in her brain even on a subconscious level, as evidenced by her lack of fear as she stared up at the being that once inspired great fear in her. In her warped mind, Molly was the kind and lovely soul who had given her the push she needed in order to get her life on the right track.

“Oh, hey there Mistress. Sorry fer the mess. We’re tryin’ ta get our stuff so we can head on outta here” she said as she gestured to the half full box on the ground. She was so far gone that she didn’t even take notice to the title she had assigned to the evil rodent. Molly grinned and gave her a pat on the head.

“Forgive my intrusion, but I’m in need of your services. You’re well acquainted with the mayor, aren’t you?” she asked in a mockingly sweet voice.

“O’course! Ah been chasin’ Vivian for so long ah almost know her better than the back o’ mah hand” Texas joked.

“Is that right?” Molly asked as her eyes lit up. “Then you would be able to find her for me, wouldn’t you?”

“Well, sure! Ah’d be happy to help ya!” the former sheriff said cheerfully. “Ah need to go pay her a visit m’self. We had a long history o’ bein’ at each other’s necks and ah think it’s only right that ah go an’ make amends”

“Uh huh, that’s real nice” Molly said with a wave of her hand. “Now get to work sniffing her out for me”

Her rude and dismissive tone went completely over Texas’ head as she walked over to the door. “April, ah’m steppin’ out for a minute! Don’t wait up!” she shouted.

“Alright! Just make sure you’re home for dinner!” her lover shouted back from the other room.

Molly licked her lips hungrily as followed the enthralled weasel, paying little mind to her inane prattling as they traveled together. As amusing as it was to see her former foe being beholden to her whim, she couldn’t quite get over the fact that her current state of mind was the result of Penelope interfering with her affairs. Once Vivian was accounted for, perhaps she would snuff them both out simultaneously. Then again, maybe she could tweak her hex to make both Texas and April loyal slaves. When they weren’t being used to sate her twisted desires, they would aid her in tracking down other wannabe lawmen. Molly shelved those thoughts for another time. She had plenty of time to consider options while she was torturing Vivian.

The issue was finding the crafty lynx.
15534231311221221111213233.title: Molly uses her control of Texas to track Vivian...

choices: Molly tries to fumigate the mansion with her farts
Molly uses her magic to draw Vivian out
Molly empowers herself with her voodoo and starts tearing the mansion down
155342313112212211112132331.content:
"Alright, here it is." The weasel declared, pointing at a large mansion. It couldn't have been more than a few miles away from Gold Springs, situated among the many farms.

"What? This close to town?" Molly muttered, surprised by the mayor's audacity.

"Vivian don't last long in places where she ain't in control. So even if she's fixin to skip town, she won't go far." Texas responded.

"Well then, I guess that saves me a long chase. Now run along, little weasel, I've got some unfinished business to attend to."

"Hol' on, ya wanna jus' storm the place? Bad idea. Ah've been in there and that mansion's a maze of secret passages an hidden rooms. And in them hidden spaces there's a small army of henchmen waitin for ya."

"Good, I could use some new minions..." Molly spoke slowly, her voice filled with malice and glee. Whatever traps Vivian had laid out in that mansion, they would not survive contact with an enemy like the voodoo rat herself.

"Ah mean it, Mistress, it's dangerous." The weasel wanted to elaborate further, but Molly shot her a vicious icy glare, making her fall silent. Her eyes widened at the horrors haunting her mind and she quickly turned around, got back on her horse and left the fat rat alone. Molly smirked. As fun as it was to instill nightmares in the weasel, she had some vengeance to enact. Her first mark was the lone lookout standing outside. He peered into the distance, keeping his rifle at the ready. The unfortunate henchman never bothered looking behind him as a wisp of smoke rose up from the ground. It solidified into a narrow tentacle, lashing towards him and wrapping tightly around his neck. He couldn't call out or sound the alarm. All he could do was watch Molly emerge from behind some shrubs and calmly walk towards him.

The rat henchman knew what had happened to his colleagues in town. How the voodoo rat had squashed all of them with ease. And now that monster was coming for him. He tried aiming his rifle towards her, but her overwhelming aura of terror made him drop his weapon. He was shivering and shaking by the time she got close enough for him to smell the pungent odour radiating off her body. The vile stench got worse and worse until her huge, sweaty asscheeks loomed over him blocking out the sun. Molly simply sat down, letting out a surprised moan as she had aimed herself better than expected. She had planned to just flatten the insignificant little henchman and move on, but judging by the wet slurping noise that came from behind he'd gone right up her ass. His futile resistance was amusing. He'd share the same fate as Penelope, trapped in the foulest hell imaginable until Molly would see fit to snuff them out for good.

"Hmmmm... good start." She mused to herself, feeling the last of the henchman get pulled inside as she stood up. Next on her agenda were the stables. She didn't want the mayor to race off again on a horse, so she'd ensure there were no horses available. The large barn was quite far removed from the mansion, presumably to make sure Vivian wouldn't be bothered by the smell or the noise. It made it easy for the fat rat to sneak towards it. Outside the main door was a guard. Inside a stable hand or something, since the guard seemed to be talking to someone. Seizing upon this distraction, Molly quickly closed the distance, her powers hiding her earth-shakingly heavy sprint.

"Ya think it's for real? Texas resigning an' all that?" The distracted guard spoke.

"Nah, that damn weasel's gonna be back, just you watch. I bet this is all some kinda ruse." The stable hand responded.

"Hah, she thinks she can fool Vivian? Tha's a goo~ hrk" His words were cut short when Molly's hand wrapped around his neck. The voodoo rat walked inside, holding the struggling scrawny henchman in front of her like a trophy.

"Jim? You okay there?" The stable hand asked, unsure why the guard stopped short. His jaw soon dropped in terror as the fat rat came in holding his friend. The horses too panicked, seemingly able to sense the overwhelming amounts of spite and malice coursing through her. Before any alarms could be rang Molly clenched her teeth and produced a loud fart. She held her trophy near her ass to let the fumes to their work and in no time he'd fallen limp. She discarded the unconscious body, laughing maniacally as the stable hand fell too. One by one the horses began to panic, but Molly was unfazed. She simply sauntered over to the main door and shoved it open. Sunlight flooded in whilst the green haze of her farts dissipated.

One by one she opened the stables for each horse, letting the animals run off. They didn't hesitate for a moment, eager to escape the cruel, smelly rat. Only one horse was left, but this one was special. It reeked of sweat. This was the horse that Vivian used to escape. This one wouldn't get off so easily. Molly opened the door, but blocked the animal's escape with her wide frame. She entered the small room, grabbing the horse's leads. With nowhere else to go she pinned it against a wall, her fat ass easily large enough to subdue it. The cruel rat then crawled onto its back, the horse's legs nearly giving out immediately. Normally her voodoo powers would assist any horse tasked with carrying her, but that kind of support was nowhere to be found now. Instead she added to the torment by scooting forward and wrapping her thighs around the horse's neck. She gave it a squeeze, slowly choking the animal out until it too had fallen unconscious. A fitting punishment for aiding Vivian in her mind. She stood towering over the unconscious horse, leaning down to whisper in its ear.

"If Vivian ever comes near, you know what to do." She spoke softly, a small wisp of purple smoke leaving her lips and entering the horse's ear. With her curse in place Molly felt confident in having her victim cut off and trapped in the mansion. Now there was simply the task of dealing with Vivian and her house of tricks.
155342313112212211112132331.title: Texas leads her to a mansion outside of town.

choices: Vivian manages to slip past them and runs to the stable.
Vivian exits through another secret hatch.
The horde captures Vivian and brings her back to Molly.
1553423131122122111121323312.content:
Confident as she was in her dark powers, Molly resisted the temptation to simply storm through the mansion in search for her prey. She had made the mistake of underestimating Vivian's cunning and as a result, her cabal of loyal servants were leave indisposed. A minor setback, one that her mind enslaving magics could easily rectify, but it was a reminder of how even the smallest slip-up on her part could grant the mayor a chance to escape again. Molly was deranged, but she never made the same mistake twice.

The massive rodent stomped over to the unconscious stable hand with without ceremony, dropped atop his helpless body. She shifted around a bit, grinding his body into a fine paste as she tried to make herself comfortable. Once she was ready, she closed her eyes and began chanting a spell in a strange and forbidden tongue. With each word spoken, a black smoke seeped from her mouth and began to envelop the stable. It didn't let up, seeping beneath the closed door and through the halls, eventually leaving everything completely enshrouded in an inky black haze. Vivian's henchmen didn't notice the encroaching threat until a particularly foul smell touched their nostrils. Whatever this substance was, it carried the distinct stench of Molly's horrid breath.

"Jeez-us! What crawled in here n' died?!" one of them wretched as he stood across beside another armed guard.

"Ugh, I dunno. Think it might be a gas leak?" his companion responded as he covered his nose.

"I ain't never smelt no gas like this! We'd better let Vivian know before... be-before..."

The henchman's voice died in his throat as the smoke began to gradually ease its way into his brain though his nose. The malicious substance dug deep into his mind, robbing him of his senses and rendering him mute. He wasn't the only one effected. Throughout the mansion, Vivian's minions were stopped dead in their tracks, the light fading from their eyes and their expressions becoming blank. Once they were all under her thrall, two words rang out through their collective consciouses.

Get Vivian.

That one phrase was burned into their minds as they shambled onward, dropping weapons or tools they happened to be holding as they began their single-minded pursuit of their former employer. For her to be able to enslave so many people at once, Molly had to make her command as simple and straight forward as possible. As a result, her zombified minions lacked much in the way of thinking power as they clumsily stumbled their way to the mayor's location, more often than not tripping over each other or knocking down a nearby vase. It didn't really matter though. They had one job, and that was to locate Vivian and force her from her hiding place. Their numbers were great enough to where they would impose an immediate threat to her, no matter how lacking they were in intellect.

The mayor herself was clueless to the encroaching hoard, as she sat in her private chambers looking through an assortment of contracts. She had managed to escape Molly's wrath for the time being, but the fearsome rodent was known for never letting up when vengeance was on her mind. That said, she wasn't the only one who carried such a reputation. Vivian's pride wouldn't allow her to simply run and hide from her foes. She make use of her connections to ensure that Molly was dealt with once and for all. The first step was to enlist the aide of the best mercenaries that money could buy. Not many people were willing to take the job given her target of choice, but she was pleased to find that there were a few hired guns who reveled at the chance to try their hands at such a formidable adversary. Once everything was sorted out, she placed the papers in a suitcase resting in her lap and sighed.

"That overgrown rodent is cutting into my funds... maybe there's a way I can profit from this?" she muttered as she stood to her feet with her hand on her chin. "I get myself some good P.R.by parading her fat ass around town. With Texas officially retired, I'll take all the credit for putting her away. That would certainly raise my stock..." she snickered as she leaned back in her seat slightly. A loud thump broke her away of her thoughts, startling her out of her seat. Her attention turned over to the only point of entry in the room, a large mahogany door where the she could hear someone knocking on the other side.

"I thought I told you idiots not to bother me while I'm working!" she yelled bitterly. She had been on edge ever since her escape, every small sound making her flinch. At the sound of her voice, the knocking stopped though it was soon followed by an uproar of activity coming from outside. Vivian wasn't sure what what happening but she could make out the sound of dozens of feet dragging through along the carpet, getting louder with each passing second. Another thud rang out as many hands began beating at her door with a with sluggish yet powerful blows.

Vivian's eyes widened as a large splinter of wood fell from the door, the familiar faces of her henchmen coming into view. It didn't take much thinking on her part to realize that they were under some kind of spell. She never discounted the probability of Molly using her own minions against her, but how on earth did she find her so fast? The only people who even knew about her hideout were Georgia and Madame Lucy. Shifty as they were, they were smart enough not to dabble with Molly and her ilk. Regardless, the hows and whys weren't important at the moment. It didn't take long for the mindless horde's persistent pummeling to bring her door crashing down. Her once loyal henchmen began pouring into the room, their empty eyes trained on the mayor as they dragged their feet towards her.
1553423131122122111121323312.title: Molly uses her magic to draw Vivian out

choices: Molly ends mayor Vivian right here and now
Molly takes Vivian back to her lair
Molly demands Vivian hand over Gold Springs to her
15534231311221221111213233121.content:
Vivian quickly ran to the opposite end of the room and put her ear against the wall. She always had a strategy in mind and Molly had given her a few hours to think up a plan.
